speaker: Narrator

text:
but his delight is in Yahweh’s law.
    On his law he meditates day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will be like a tree planted by the streams of water,
    that produces its fruit in its season,
    whose leaf also does not wither.
    Whatever he does shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are not so,
    but are like the chaff which the wind drives away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment,
    nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh knows the way of the righteous,
    but the way of the wicked shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do the nations rage,
    and the peoples plot a vain thing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of the earth take a stand,
    and the rulers take counsel together,
    against Yahweh, and against his Anointed, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Let’s break their bonds apart,
    and cast their cords from us.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who sits in the heavens will laugh.
    The Lord will have them in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he will speak to them in his anger,
    and terrify them in his wrath:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yet I have set my King on my holy hill of Zion.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will tell of the decree:
Yahweh said to me, “You are my son.
    Today I have become your father.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ask of me, and I will give the nations for your inheritance,
    the uttermost parts of the earth for your possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall break them with a rod of iron.
    You shall dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now therefore be wise, you kings.
    Be instructed, you judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Serve Yahweh with fear,
    and rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give sincere homage to the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish on the way,
    for his wrath will soon be kindled.
    Blessed are all those who take refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, how my adversaries have increased!
    Many are those who rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many there are who say of my soul,
    “There is no help for him in God.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me,
    my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry to Yahweh with my voice,
    and he answers me out of his holy hill. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I laid myself down and slept.
    I awakened, for Yahweh sustains me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not be afraid of tens of thousands of people
    who have set themselves against me on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, Yahweh!
    Save me, my God!
For you have struck all of my enemies on the cheek bone.
    You have broken the teeth of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salvation belongs to Yahweh.
    May your blessing be on your people. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness.
    Give me relief from my distress.
    Have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonor?
    Will you love vanity and seek after falsehood? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But know that Yahweh has set apart for himself him who is godly;
    Yahweh will hear when I call to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stand in awe, and don’t sin.
    Search your own heart on your bed, and be still. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness.
    Put your trust in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many say, “Who will show us any good?”
    Yahweh, let the light of your face shine on us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have put gladness in my heart,
    more than when their grain and their new wine are increased.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In peace I will both lay myself down and sleep,
    for you alone, Yahweh, make me live in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear to my words, Yahweh.
    Consider my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to the voice of my cry, my King and my God,
    for I pray to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, in the morning you will hear my voice.
    In the morning I will lay my requests before you, and will watch expectantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness.
    Evil can’t live with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arrogant will not stand in your sight.
    You hate all workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will destroy those who speak lies.
    Yahweh abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, in the abundance of your loving kindness I will come into your house.
    I will bow toward your holy temple in reverence of you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lead me, Yahweh, in your righteousness because of my enemies.
    Make your way straight before my face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there is no faithfulness in their mouth.
    Their heart is destruction.
    Their throat is an open tomb.
    They flatter with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hold them guilty, God.
    Let them fall by their own counsels.
Thrust them out in the multitude of their transgressions,
    for they have rebelled against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let all those who take refuge in you rejoice.
    Let them always shout for joy, because you defend them.
Let them also who love your name be joyful in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will bless the righteous.
Yahweh, you will surround him with favor as with a shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, don’t rebuke me in your anger,
    neither discipline me in your wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on me, Yahweh, for I am faint.
    Yahweh, heal me, for my bones are troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is also in great anguish.
    But you, Yahweh—how long?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, Yahweh. Deliver my soul,
    and save me for your loving kindness’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For in death there is no memory of you.
    In Sheol, who shall give you thanks?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am weary with my groaning.
    Every night I flood my bed.
    I drench my couch with my tears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eye wastes away because of grief.
    It grows old because of all my adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity,
    for Yahweh has heard the voice of my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has heard my supplication.
    Yahweh accepts my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all my enemies be ashamed and dismayed.
    They shall turn back, they shall be disgraced suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, my God, I take refuge in you.
    Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest they tear apart my soul like a lion,
    ripping it in pieces, while there is no one to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, my God, if I have done this,
    if there is iniquity in my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if I have rewarded evil to him who was at peace with me
    (yes, I have plundered him who without cause was my adversary),
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Arise, Yahweh, in your anger.
    Lift up yourself against the rage of my adversaries.
Awake for me. You have commanded judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the congregation of the peoples surround you.
    Rule over them on high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh administers judgment to the peoples.
    Judge me, Yahweh, according to my righteousness,
    and to my integrity that is in me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My shield is with God,
    who saves the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is a righteous judge,
    yes, a God who has indignation every day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If a man doesn’t repent, he will sharpen his sword;
    he has bent and strung his bow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has also prepared for himself the instruments of death.
    He makes ready his flaming arrows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, he travails with iniquity.
    Yes, he has conceived mischief,
    and brought out falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has dug a hole,
    and has fallen into the pit which he made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The trouble he causes shall return to his own head.
    His violence shall come down on the crown of his own head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to Yahweh according to his righteousness,
    and will sing praise to the name of Yahweh Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!
    You have set your glory above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the lips of babes and infants you have established strength,
    because of your adversaries, that you might silence the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers,
    the moon and the stars, which you have ordained,
speaker: Narrator

text:
what is man, that you think of him?
    What is the son of man, that you care for him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have made him a little lower than the angels,
    and crowned him with glory and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make him ruler over the works of your hands.
    You have put all things under his feet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
All sheep and cattle,
    yes, and the animals of the field,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the birds of the sky, the fish of the sea,
    and whatever passes through the paths of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, our Lord,
    how majestic is your name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart.
    I will tell of all your marvelous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be glad and rejoice in you.
    I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my enemies turn back,
    they stumble and perish in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have maintained my just cause.
    You sit on the throne judging righteously.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rebuked the nations.
    You have destroyed the wicked.
    You have blotted out their name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The enemy is overtaken by endless ruin.
    The very memory of the cities which you have overthrown has perished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Yahweh reigns forever.
    He has prepared his throne for judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will judge the world in righteousness.
    He will administer judgment to the peoples in uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will also be a high tower for the oppressed;
    a high tower in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who know your name will put their trust in you,
    for you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to Yahweh, who dwells in Zion,
    and declare among the people what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he who avenges blood remembers them.
    He doesn’t forget the cry of the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on me, Yahweh.
    See my affliction by those who hate me,
and lift me up from the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I may show all of your praise.
    I will rejoice in your salvation in the gates of the daughter of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made.
    In the net which they hid, their own foot is taken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has made himself known.
    He has executed judgment.
    The wicked is snared by the work of his own hands. Meditation. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked shall be turned back to Sheol,
    even all the nations that forget God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the needy shall not always be forgotten,
    nor the hope of the poor perish forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, Yahweh! Don’t let man prevail.
    Let the nations be judged in your sight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put them in fear, Yahweh.
    Let the nations know that they are only men. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you stand far off, Yahweh?
    Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
In arrogance, the wicked hunt down the weak.
    They are caught in the schemes that they devise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the wicked boasts of his heart’s cravings.
    He blesses the greedy and condemns Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked, in the pride of his face,
    has no room in his thoughts for God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His ways are prosperous at all times.
    He is arrogant, and your laws are far from his sight.
As for all his adversaries, he sneers at them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says in his heart, “I shall not be shaken.
    For generations I shall have no trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and oppression.
    Under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lies in wait near the villages.
    From ambushes, he murders the innocent.
His eyes are secretly set against the helpless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lurks in secret as a lion in his ambush.
    He lies in wait to catch the helpless.
    He catches the helpless when he draws him in his net.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The helpless are crushed.
    They collapse.
    They fall under his strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten.
    He hides his face.
    He will never see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, Yahweh!
    God, lift up your hand!
    Don’t forget the helpless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why does the wicked person condemn God,
    and say in his heart, “God won’t call me into account”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you do see trouble and grief.
    You consider it to take it into your hand.
    You help the victim and the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Break the arm of the wicked.
    As for the evil man, seek out his wickedness until you find none.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is King forever and ever!
    The nations will perish out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, you have heard the desire of the humble.
    You will prepare their heart.
    You will cause your ear to hear,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to judge the fatherless and the oppressed,
    that man who is of the earth may terrify no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In Yahweh, I take refuge.
    How can you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird to your mountain”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, the wicked bend their bows.
    They set their arrows on the strings,
    that they may shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the foundations are destroyed,
    what can the righteous do?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is in his holy temple.
    Yahweh is on his throne in heaven.
His eyes observe.
    His eyes examine the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh examines the righteous,
    but his soul hates the wicked and him who loves violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the wicked he will rain blazing coals;
    fire, sulfur, and scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh is righteous.
    He loves righteousness.
    The upright shall see his face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help, Yahweh; for the godly man ceases.
    For the faithful fail from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone lies to his neighbor.
    They speak with flattering lips, and with a double heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips,
    and the tongue that boasts,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who have said, “With our tongue we will prevail.
    Our lips are our own.
    Who is lord over us?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s words are flawless words,
    as silver refined in a clay furnace, purified seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will keep them, Yahweh.
    You will preserve them from this generation forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked walk on every side,
    when what is vile is exalted among the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, Yahweh?
    Will you forget me forever?
    How long will you hide your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long shall I take counsel in my soul,
    having sorrow in my heart every day?
    How long shall my enemy triumph over me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, and answer me, Yahweh, my God.
    Give light to my eyes, lest I sleep in death;
speaker: Narrator

text:
lest my enemy say, “I have prevailed against him;”
    lest my adversaries rejoice when I fall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I trust in your loving kindness.
    My heart rejoices in your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to Yahweh,
    because he has been good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”
    They are corrupt.
    They have done abominable deeds.
    There is no one who does good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh looked down from heaven on the children of men,
    to see if there were any who understood,
    who sought after God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have all gone aside.
    They have together become corrupt.
    There is no one who does good, no, not one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
    who eat up my people as they eat bread,
    and don’t call on Yahweh?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they were in great fear,
    for God is in the generation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You frustrate the plan of the poor,
    because Yahweh is his refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!
    When Yahweh restores the fortunes of his people,
    then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, who shall dwell in your sanctuary?
    Who shall live on your holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who walks blamelessly and does what is right,
    and speaks truth in his heart;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
he who doesn’t lend out his money for usury,
    nor take a bribe against the innocent. 
He who does these things shall never be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, God, for I take refuge in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul, you have said to Yahweh, “You are my Lord.
    Apart from you I have no good thing.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for the saints who are in the earth,
    they are the excellent ones in whom is all my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their sorrows shall be multiplied who give gifts to another god.
    Their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
    nor take their names on my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh assigned my portion and my cup.
    You made my lot secure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lines have fallen to me in pleasant places.
    Yes, I have a good inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless Yahweh, who has given me counsel.
    Yes, my heart instructs me in the night seasons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have set Yahweh always before me.
    Because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore my heart is glad, and my tongue rejoices.
    My body shall also dwell in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will not leave my soul in Sheol,
    neither will you allow your holy one to see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will show me the path of life.
    In your presence is fullness of joy.
In your right hand there are pleasures forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, Yahweh, my righteous plea.
    Give ear to my prayer that doesn’t go out of deceitful lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my sentence come out of your presence.
    Let your eyes look on equity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have proved my heart.
    You have visited me in the night.
    You have tried me, and found nothing.
    I have resolved that my mouth shall not disobey.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for the deeds of men, by the word of your lips,
    I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My steps have held fast to your paths.
    My feet have not slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called on you, for you will answer me, God.
    Turn your ear to me.
    Hear my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show your marvelous loving kindness,
    you who save those who take refuge by your right hand from their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me as the apple of your eye.
    Hide me under the shadow of your wings,
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the wicked who oppress me,
    my deadly enemies, who surround me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They close up their callous hearts.
    With their mouth they speak proudly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have now surrounded us in our steps.
    They set their eyes to cast us down to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is like a lion that is greedy of his prey,
    as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, Yahweh, confront him.
    Cast him down.
Deliver my soul from the wicked by your sword,
speaker: Narrator

text:
from men by your hand, Yahweh,
    from men of the world, whose portion is in this life.
You fill the belly of your cherished ones.
    Your sons have plenty,
    and they store up wealth for their children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I shall see your face in righteousness.
    I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with seeing your form.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love you, Yahweh, my strength.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I call on Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised;
    and I am saved from my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of death surrounded me.
    The floods of ungodliness made me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of Sheol were around me.
    The snares of death came on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress I called on Yahweh,
    and cried to my God.
He heard my voice out of his temple.
    My cry before him came into his ears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the earth shook and trembled.
    The foundations also of the mountains quaked and were shaken,
    because he was angry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Smoke went out of his nostrils.
    Consuming fire came out of his mouth.
    Coals were kindled by it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He bowed the heavens also, and came down.
    Thick darkness was under his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rode on a cherub, and flew.
    Yes, he soared on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made darkness his hiding place, his pavilion around him,
    darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed,
    hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh also thundered in the sky.
    The Most High uttered his voice:
    hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent out his arrows, and scattered them.
    He routed them with great lightning bolts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the channels of waters appeared.
    The foundations of the world were laid bare at your rebuke, Yahweh,
    at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent from on high.
    He took me.
    He drew me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
    from those who hated me; for they were too mighty for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They came on me in the day of my calamity,
    but Yahweh was my support.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought me out also into a large place.
    He delivered me, because he delighted in me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness.
    According to the cleanness of my hands, he has recompensed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have kept the ways of Yahweh,
    and have not wickedly departed from my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all his ordinances were before me.
    I didn’t put away his statutes from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was also blameless with him.
    I kept myself from my iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness,
    according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the merciful you will show yourself merciful.
    With the perfect man, you will show yourself perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the pure, you will show yourself pure.
    With the crooked you will show yourself shrewd.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will save the afflicted people,
    but the arrogant eyes you will bring down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will light my lamp, Yahweh.
    My God will light up my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by you, I advance through a troop.
    By my God, I leap over a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for God, his way is perfect.
    Yahweh’s word is tried.
    He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For who is God, except Yahweh?
    Who is a rock, besides our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: the God who arms me with strength, and makes my way perfect?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes my feet like deer’s feet,
    and sets me on my high places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He teaches my hands to war,
    so that my arms bend a bow of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have also given me the shield of your salvation.
    Your right hand sustains me.
    Your gentleness has made me great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have enlarged my steps under me,
    My feet have not slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will pursue my enemies, and overtake them.
    I won’t turn away until they are consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will strike them through, so that they will not be able to rise.
    They shall fall under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have armed me with strength to the battle.
    You have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me,
    that I might cut off those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried, but there was no one to save;
    even to Yahweh, but he didn’t answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I beat them small as the dust before the wind.
    I cast them out as the mire of the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have delivered me from the strivings of the people.
    You have made me the head of the nations.
A people whom I have not known shall serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As soon as they hear of me they shall obey me.
    The foreigners shall submit themselves to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The foreigners shall fade away,
    and shall come trembling out of their strongholds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh lives! Blessed be my rock.
    Exalted be the God of my salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even the God who executes vengeance for me,
    and subdues peoples under me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rescues me from my enemies.
    Yes, you lift me up above those who rise up against me.
    You deliver me from the violent man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations,
    and will sing praises to your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives great deliverance to his king,
    and shows loving kindness to his anointed,
    to David and to his offspring, forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens declare the glory of God.
    The expanse shows his handiwork.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day after day they pour out speech,
    and night after night they display knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no speech nor language
    where their voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their voice has gone out through all the earth,
    their words to the end of the world.
In them he has set a tent for the sun,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which is as a bridegroom coming out of his room,
    like a strong man rejoicing to run his course.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His going out is from the end of the heavens,
    his circuit to its ends.
    There is nothing hidden from its heat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s law is perfect, restoring the soul.
    Yahweh’s covenant is sure, making wise the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s precepts are right, rejoicing the heart.
    Yahweh’s commandment is pure, enlightening the eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of Yahweh is clean, enduring forever.
    Yahweh’s ordinances are true, and righteous altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are more to be desired than gold, yes, than much fine gold,
    sweeter also than honey and the extract of the honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover your servant is warned by them.
    In keeping them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can discern his errors?
    Forgive me from hidden errors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep back your servant also from presumptuous sins.
    Let them not have dominion over me.
Then I will be upright.
    I will be blameless and innocent of great transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable in your sight,
    Yahweh, my rock, and my redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Yahweh answer you in the day of trouble.
    May the name of the God of Jacob set you up on high,
speaker: Narrator

text:
send you help from the sanctuary,
    grant you support from Zion,
speaker: Narrator

text:
remember all your offerings,
    and accept your burned sacrifice. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May he grant you your heart’s desire,
    and fulfill all your counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We will triumph in your salvation.
    In the name of our God, we will set up our banners.
    May Yahweh grant all your requests.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now I know that Yahweh saves his anointed.
    He will answer him from his holy heaven,
    with the saving strength of his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some trust in chariots, and some in horses,
    but we trust in the name of Yahweh our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are bowed down and fallen,
    but we rise up, and stand upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save, Yahweh!
    Let the King answer us when we call!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king rejoices in your strength, Yahweh!
    How greatly he rejoices in your salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given him his heart’s desire,
    and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you meet him with the blessings of goodness.
    You set a crown of fine gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked life of you and you gave it to him,
    even length of days forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His glory is great in your salvation.
    You lay honor and majesty on him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you make him most blessed forever.
    You make him glad with joy in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the king trusts in Yahweh.
    Through the loving kindness of the Most High, he shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hand will find out all of your enemies.
    Your right hand will find out those who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will make them as a fiery furnace in the time of your anger.
    Yahweh will swallow them up in his wrath.
    The fire shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will destroy their descendants from the earth,
    their posterity from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they intended evil against you.
    They plotted evil against you which cannot succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will make them turn their back,
    when you aim drawn bows at their face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, Yahweh, in your strength,
    so we will sing and praise your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
    Why are you so far from helping me, and from the words of my groaning?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, I cry in the daytime, but you don’t answer;
    in the night season, and am not silent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are holy,
    you who inhabit the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our fathers trusted in you.
    They trusted, and you delivered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried to you, and were delivered.
    They trusted in you, and were not disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am a worm, and no man;
    a reproach of men, and despised by the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All those who see me mock me.
    They insult me with their lips. They shake their heads, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He trusts in Yahweh.
    Let him deliver him.
    Let him rescue him, since he delights in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you brought me out of the womb.
    You made me trust while at my mother’s breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was thrown on you from my mother’s womb.
    You are my God since my mother bore me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t be far from me, for trouble is near.
    For there is no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many bulls have surrounded me.
    Strong bulls of Bashan have encircled me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They open their mouths wide against me,
    lions tearing prey and roaring.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am poured out like water.
    All my bones are out of joint.
My heart is like wax.
    It is melted within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My strength is dried up like a potsherd.
    My tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
You have brought me into the dust of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For dogs have surrounded me.
    A company of evildoers have enclosed me.
    They have pierced my hands and feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I can count all of my bones.
They look and stare at me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They divide my garments among them.
    They cast lots for my clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But don’t be far off, Yahweh.
    You are my help. Hurry to help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver my soul from the sword,
    my precious life from the power of the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me from the lion’s mouth!
    Yes, you have rescued me from the horns of the wild oxen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will declare your name to my brothers.
    Among the assembly, I will praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who fear Yahweh, praise him!
    All you descendants of Jacob, glorify him!
    Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My praise of you comes in the great assembly.
    I will pay my vows before those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The humble shall eat and be satisfied.
    They shall praise Yahweh who seek after him.
    Let your hearts live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to Yahweh.
    All the relatives of the nations shall worship before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the kingdom is Yahweh’s.
    He is the ruler over the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the rich ones of the earth shall eat and worship.
    All those who go down to the dust shall bow before him,
    even he who can’t keep his soul alive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Posterity shall serve him.
    Future generations shall be told about the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall come and shall declare his righteousness to a people that shall be born,
    for he has done it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is my shepherd;
    I shall lack nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures.
    He leads me beside still waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He restores my soul.
    He guides me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
    I will fear no evil, for you are with me.
Your rod and your staff,
    they comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You prepare a table before me
    in the presence of my enemies.
You anoint my head with oil.
    My cup runs over.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely goodness and loving kindness shall follow me all the days of my life,
    and I will dwell in Yahweh’s house forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness;
    the world, and those who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has founded it on the seas,
    and established it on the floods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who may ascend to Yahweh’s hill?
    Who may stand in his holy place?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He shall receive a blessing from Yahweh,
    righteousness from the God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the generation of those who seek Him,
    who seek your face—even Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your heads, you gates!
    Be lifted up, you everlasting doors,
    and the King of glory will come in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is the King of glory?
    Yahweh strong and mighty,
    Yahweh mighty in battle.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who is this King of glory?
    Yahweh of Armies is the King of glory! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To you, Yahweh, I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, I have trusted in you.
    Don’t let me be shamed.
    Don’t let my enemies triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, no one who waits for you will be shamed.
    They will be shamed who deal treacherously without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show me your ways, Yahweh.
    Teach me your paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guide me in your truth, and teach me,
    for you are the God of my salvation.
    I wait for you all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, remember your tender mercies and your loving kindness,
    for they are from old times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t remember the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions.
    Remember me according to your loving kindness,
    for your goodness’ sake, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Good and upright is Yahweh,
    therefore he will instruct sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will guide the humble in justice.
    He will teach the humble his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the paths of Yahweh are loving kindness and truth
    to such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your name’s sake, Yahweh,
    pardon my iniquity, for it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What man is he who fears Yahweh?
    He shall instruct him in the way that he shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His soul will dwell at ease.
    His offspring will inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The friendship of Yahweh is with those who fear him.
    He will show them his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are ever on Yahweh,
    for he will pluck my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
    for I am desolate and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The troubles of my heart are enlarged.
    Oh bring me out of my distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider my affliction and my travail.
    Forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider my enemies, for they are many.
    They hate me with cruel hatred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh keep my soul, and deliver me.
    Let me not be disappointed, for I take refuge in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
    for I wait for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, redeem Israel
    out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judge me, Yahweh, for I have walked in my integrity.
    I have trusted also in Yahweh without wavering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Examine me, Yahweh, and prove me.
    Try my heart and my mind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your loving kindness is before my eyes.
    I have walked in your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not sat with deceitful men,
    neither will I go in with hypocrites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate the assembly of evildoers,
    and will not sit with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will wash my hands in innocence,
    so I will go about your altar, Yahweh,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard
    and tell of all your wondrous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, I love the habitation of your house,
    the place where your glory dwells.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t gather my soul with sinners,
    nor my life with bloodthirsty men
speaker: Narrator

text:
in whose hands is wickedness;
    their right hand is full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, I will walk in my integrity.
    Redeem me, and be merciful to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My foot stands in an even place.
    In the congregations I will bless Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is my light and my salvation.
    Whom shall I fear?
Yahweh is the strength of my life.
    Of whom shall I be afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text:
When evildoers came at me to eat up my flesh,
    even my adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though an army should encamp against me,
    my heart shall not fear.
Though war should rise against me,
    even then I will be confident.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One thing I have asked of Yahweh, that I will seek after:
    that I may dwell in Yahweh’s house all the days of my life,
    to see Yahweh’s beauty,
    and to inquire in his temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For in the day of trouble, he will keep me secretly in his pavilion.
    In the secret place of his tabernacle, he will hide me.
    He will lift me up on a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now my head will be lifted up above my enemies around me.
I will offer sacrifices of joy in his tent.
    I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, Yahweh, when I cry with my voice.
    Have mercy also on me, and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you said, “Seek my face,”
    my heart said to you, “I will seek your face, Yahweh.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t hide your face from me.
    Don’t put your servant away in anger.
You have been my help.
    Don’t abandon me,
    neither forsake me, God of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my father and my mother forsake me,
    then Yahweh will take me up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me your way, Yahweh.
    Lead me in a straight path, because of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I am still confident of this:
    I will see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wait for Yahweh.
    Be strong, and let your heart take courage.
Yes, wait for Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To you, Yahweh, I call.
    My rock, don’t be deaf to me,
    lest, if you are silent to me,
    I would become like those who go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear the voice of my petitions, when I cry to you,
    when I lift up my hands toward your Most Holy Place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t draw me away with the wicked,
    with the workers of iniquity who speak peace with their neighbors,
    but mischief is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give them according to their work, and according to the wickedness of their doings.
    Give them according to the operation of their hands.
    Bring back on them what they deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because they don’t respect the works of Yahweh,
    nor the operation of his hands,
    he will break them down and not build them up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh,
    because he has heard the voice of my petitions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is my strength and my shield.
    My heart has trusted in him, and I am helped.
Therefore my heart greatly rejoices.
    With my song I will thank him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is their strength.
    He is a stronghold of salvation to his anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save your people,
    and bless your inheritance.
Be their shepherd also,
    and bear them up forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to Yahweh, you sons of the mighty,
    ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name.
    Worship Yahweh in holy array.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s voice is on the waters.
    The God of glory thunders, even Yahweh on many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s voice is powerful.
    Yahweh’s voice is full of majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s voice breaks the cedars.
    Yes, Yahweh breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes them also to skip like a calf;
    Lebanon and Sirion like a young, wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh’s voice strikes with flashes of lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s voice shakes the wilderness.
    Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s voice makes the deer calve,
    and strips the forests bare.
    In his temple everything says, “Glory!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh sat enthroned at the Flood.
    Yes, Yahweh sits as King forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will give strength to his people.
    Yahweh will bless his people with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will extol you, Yahweh, for you have raised me up,
    and have not made my foes to rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh my God, I cried to you,
    and you have healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, you have brought up my soul from Sheol.
    You have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praise to Yahweh, you saints of his.
    Give thanks to his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For his anger is but for a moment.
    His favor is for a lifetime.
Weeping may stay for the night,
    but joy comes in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I said in my prosperity,
    “I shall never be moved.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, Yahweh, when you favored me, made my mountain stand strong;
    but when you hid your face, I was troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried to you, Yahweh.
    I made supplication to the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What profit is there in my destruction, if I go down to the pit?
    Shall the dust praise you?
    Shall it declare your truth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, Yahweh, and have mercy on me.
    Yahweh, be my helper.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have turned my mourning into dancing for me.
    You have removed my sackcloth, and clothed me with gladness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to the end that my heart may sing praise to you, and not be silent.
Yahweh my God, I will give thanks to you forever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
In you, Yahweh, I take refuge.
    Let me never be disappointed.
    Deliver me in your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bow down your ear to me.
    Deliver me speedily.
Be to me a strong rock,
    a house of defense to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are my rock and my fortress,
    therefore for your name’s sake lead me and guide me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pluck me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me,
    for you are my stronghold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Into your hand I commend my spirit.
    You redeem me, Yahweh, God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate those who regard lying vanities,
    but I trust in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be glad and rejoice in your loving kindness,
    for you have seen my affliction.
    You have known my soul in adversities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have not shut me up into the hand of the enemy.
    You have set my feet in a large place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on me, Yahweh, for I am in distress.
    My eye, my soul, and my body waste away with grief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my life is spent with sorrow,
    my years with sighing.
My strength fails because of my iniquity.
    My bones are wasted away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of all my adversaries I have become utterly contemptible to my neighbors,
    a horror to my acquaintances.
    Those who saw me on the street fled from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am forgotten from their hearts like a dead man.
    I am like broken pottery.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But I trust in you, Yahweh.
    I said, “You are my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My times are in your hand.
    Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make your face to shine on your servant.
    Save me in your loving kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me not be disappointed, Yahweh, for I have called on you.
    Let the wicked be disappointed.
    Let them be silent in Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the lying lips be mute,
    which speak against the righteous insolently, with pride and contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh how great is your goodness,
    which you have laid up for those who fear you,
    which you have worked for those who take refuge in you,
    before the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the shelter of your presence you will hide them from the plotting of man.
    You will keep them secretly in a dwelling away from the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise be to Yahweh,
    for he has shown me his marvelous loving kindness in a strong city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I said in my haste, “I am cut off from before your eyes.”
    Nevertheless you heard the voice of my petitions when I cried to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh love Yahweh, all you his saints!
    Yahweh preserves the faithful,
and fully recompenses him who behaves arrogantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be strong, and let your heart take courage,
    all you who hope in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is he whose disobedience is forgiven,
    whose sin is covered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man to whom Yahweh doesn’t impute iniquity,
    in whose spirit there is no deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I kept silence, my bones wasted away through my groaning all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For day and night your hand was heavy on me.
    My strength was sapped in the heat of summer. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I acknowledged my sin to you.
    I didn’t hide my iniquity.
I said, I will confess my transgressions to Yahweh,
    and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this, let everyone who is godly pray to you in a time when you may be found.
    Surely when the great waters overflow, they shall not reach to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place.
    You will preserve me from trouble.
    You will surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you shall go.
    I will counsel you with my eye on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t be like the horse, or like the mule, which have no understanding,
    who are controlled by bit and bridle, or else they will not come near to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many sorrows come to the wicked,
    but loving kindness shall surround him who trusts in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be glad in Yahweh, and rejoice, you righteous!
    Shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rejoice in Yahweh, you righteous!
    Praise is fitting for the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to Yahweh with the lyre.
    Sing praises to him with the harp of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him a new song.
    Play skillfully with a shout of joy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh’s word is right.
    All his work is done in faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He loves righteousness and justice.
    The earth is full of the loving kindness of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By Yahweh’s word, the heavens were made:
    all their army by the breath of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap.
    He lays up the deeps in storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all the earth fear Yahweh.
    Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he spoke, and it was done.
    He commanded, and it stood firm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh brings the counsel of the nations to nothing.
    He makes the thoughts of the peoples to be of no effect.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The counsel of Yahweh stands fast forever,
    the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the nation whose God is Yahweh,
    the people whom he has chosen for his own inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh looks from heaven.
    He sees all the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the place of his habitation he looks out on all the inhabitants of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he who fashions all of their hearts;
    and he considers all of their works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no king saved by the multitude of an army.
    A mighty man is not delivered by great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A horse is a vain thing for safety,
    neither does he deliver any by his great power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, Yahweh’s eye is on those who fear him,
    on those who hope in his loving kindness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to deliver their soul from death,
    to keep them alive in famine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul has waited for Yahweh.
    He is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our heart rejoices in him,
    because we have trusted in his holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your loving kindness be on us, Yahweh,
    since we have hoped in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless Yahweh at all times.
    His praise will always be in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul shall boast in Yahweh.
    The humble shall hear of it and be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh magnify Yahweh with me.
    Let’s exalt his name together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sought Yahweh, and he answered me,
    and delivered me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They looked to him, and were radiant.
    Their faces shall never be covered with shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This poor man cried, and Yahweh heard him,
    and saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s angel encamps around those who fear him,
    and delivers them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh taste and see that Yahweh is good.
    Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh fear Yahweh, you his saints,
    for there is no lack with those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger,
    but those who seek Yahweh shall not lack any good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, you children, listen to me.
    I will teach you the fear of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is someone who desires life,
    and loves many days, that he may see good?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your tongue from evil,
    and your lips from speaking lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from evil, and do good.
    Seek peace, and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s eyes are toward the righteous.
    His ears listen to their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s face is against those who do evil,
    to cut off their memory from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous cry, and Yahweh hears,
    and delivers them out of all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is near to those who have a broken heart,
    and saves those who have a crushed spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
    but Yahweh delivers him out of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He protects all of his bones.
    Not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evil shall kill the wicked.
    Those who hate the righteous shall be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh redeems the soul of his servants.
    None of those who take refuge in him shall be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Contend, Yahweh, with those who contend with me.
    Fight against those who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take hold of shield and buckler,
    and stand up for my help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Brandish the spear and block those who pursue me.
    Tell my soul, “I am your salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who seek after my soul be disappointed and brought to dishonor.
    Let those who plot my ruin be turned back and confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be as chaff before the wind,
    Yahweh’s angel driving them on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their way be dark and slippery,
    Yahweh’s angel pursuing them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For without cause they have hidden their net in a pit for me.
    Without cause they have dug a pit for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let destruction come on him unawares.
    Let his net that he has hidden catch himself.
    Let him fall into that destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul shall be joyful in Yahweh.
    It shall rejoice in his salvation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Unrighteous witnesses rise up.
    They ask me about things that I don’t know about.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They reward me evil for good,
    to the bereaving of my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth.
    I afflicted my soul with fasting.
    My prayer returned into my own bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother.
    I bowed down mourning, as one who mourns his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But in my adversity, they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together.
    The attackers gathered themselves together against me, and I didn’t know it.
    They tore at me, and didn’t cease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like the profane mockers in feasts,
    they gnashed their teeth at me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, how long will you look on?
    Rescue my soul from their destruction,
    my precious life from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks in the great assembly.
    I will praise you among many people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let those who are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me;
    neither let those who hate me without a cause wink their eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they don’t speak peace,
    but they devise deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they opened their mouth wide against me.
    They said, “Aha! Aha! Our eye has seen it!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have seen it, Yahweh. Don’t keep silent.
    Lord, don’t be far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up! Rise up to defend me, my God!
    My Lord, contend for me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vindicate me, Yahweh my God, according to your righteousness.
    Don’t let them gloat over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let them say in their heart, “Aha! That’s the way we want it!”
    Don’t let them say, “We have swallowed him up!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be disappointed and confounded together who rejoice at my calamity.
    Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who favor my righteous cause shout for joy and be glad.
    Yes, let them say continually, “May Yahweh be magnified,
    who has pleasure in the prosperity of his servant!”
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue shall talk about your righteousness and about your praise all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A revelation is within my heart about the disobedience of the wicked:
    There is no fear of God before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he flatters himself in his own eyes,
    too much to detect and hate his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit.
    He has ceased to be wise and to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He plots iniquity on his bed.
    He sets himself in a way that is not good.
    He doesn’t abhor evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your loving kindness, Yahweh, is in the heavens.
    Your faithfulness reaches to the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is like the mountains of God.
    Your judgments are like a great deep.
    Yahweh, you preserve man and animal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How precious is your loving kindness, God!
    The children of men take refuge under the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be abundantly satisfied with the abundance of your house.
    You will make them drink of the river of your pleasures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For with you is the spring of life.
    In your light we will see light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh continue your loving kindness to those who know you,
    your righteousness to the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let the foot of pride come against me.
    Don’t let the hand of the wicked drive me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the workers of iniquity are fallen.
    They are thrust down, and shall not be able to rise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t fret because of evildoers,
    neither be envious against those who work unrighteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,
    and wither like the green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in Yahweh, and do good.
    Dwell in the land, and enjoy safe pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also delight yourself in Yahweh,
    and he will give you the desires of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Commit your way to Yahweh.
    Trust also in him, and he will do this:
speaker: Narrator

text:
he will make your righteousness shine out like light,
    and your justice as the noon day sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rest in Yahweh, and wait patiently for him.
    Don’t fret because of him who prospers in his way,
    because of the man who makes wicked plots happen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cease from anger, and forsake wrath.
    Don’t fret; it leads only to evildoing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For evildoers shall be cut off,
    but those who wait for Yahweh shall inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more.
    Yes, though you look for his place, he isn’t there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the humble shall inherit the land,
    and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked plots against the just,
    and gnashes at him with his teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will laugh at him,
    for he sees that his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,
    to cast down the poor and needy,
    to kill those who are upright on the path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their sword shall enter into their own heart.
    Their bows shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a little that the righteous has,
    than the abundance of many wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
    but Yahweh upholds the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh knows the days of the perfect.
    Their inheritance shall be forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall not be disappointed in the time of evil.
    In the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the wicked shall perish.
    The enemies of Yahweh shall be like the beauty of the fields.
    They will vanish—
    vanish like smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked borrow, and don’t pay back,
    but the righteous give generously.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For such as are blessed by him shall inherit the land.
    Those who are cursed by him shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man’s steps are established by Yahweh.
    He delights in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though he stumble, he shall not fall,
    for Yahweh holds him up with his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have been young, and now am old,
    yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken,
    nor his children begging for bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long he deals graciously, and lends.
    His offspring is blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from evil, and do good.
    Live securely forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh loves justice,
    and doesn’t forsake his saints.
    They are preserved forever,
    but the children of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous shall inherit the land,
    and live in it forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the righteous talks of wisdom.
    His tongue speaks justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The law of his God is in his heart.
    None of his steps shall slide.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked watch the righteous,
    and seek to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will not leave him in his hand,
    nor condemn him when he is judged.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wait for Yahweh, and keep his way,
    and he will exalt you to inherit the land.
    When the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen the wicked in great power,
    spreading himself like a green tree in its native soil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he passed away, and behold, he was not.
    Yes, I sought him, but he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mark the perfect man, and see the upright,
    for there is a future for the man of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together.
    The future of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the salvation of the righteous is from Yahweh.
    He is their stronghold in the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh helps them and rescues them.
    He rescues them from the wicked and saves them,
    because they have taken refuge in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, don’t rebuke me in your wrath,
    neither chasten me in your hot displeasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your arrows have pierced me,
    your hand presses hard on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation,
    neither is there any health in my bones because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my iniquities have gone over my head.
    As a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My wounds are loathsome and corrupt
    because of my foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am in pain and bowed down greatly.
    I go mourning all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my waist is filled with burning.
    There is no soundness in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am faint and severely bruised.
    I have groaned by reason of the anguish of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, all my desire is before you.
    My groaning is not hidden from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart throbs.
    My strength fails me.
    As for the light of my eyes, it has also left me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague.
    My kinsmen stand far away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They also who seek after my life lay snares.
    Those who seek my hurt speak mischievous things,
    and meditate deceits all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I, as a deaf man, don’t hear.
    I am as a mute man who doesn’t open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I am as a man who doesn’t hear,
    in whose mouth are no reproofs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I hope in you, Yahweh.
    You will answer, Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I said, “Don’t let them gloat over me,
    or exalt themselves over me when my foot slips.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am ready to fall.
    My pain is continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will declare my iniquity.
    I will be sorry for my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my enemies are vigorous and many.
    Those who hate me without reason are numerous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They who render evil for good are also adversaries to me,
    because I follow what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t forsake me, Yahweh.
    My God, don’t be far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hurry to help me,
    Lord, my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “I will watch my ways, so that I don’t sin with my tongue.
    I will keep my mouth with a bridle while the wicked is before me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was mute with silence.
    I held my peace, even from good.
    My sorrow was stirred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart was hot within me.
    While I meditated, the fire burned.
I spoke with my tongue:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Yahweh, show me my end,
    what is the measure of my days.
    Let me know how frail I am.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, you have made my days hand widths.
    My lifetime is as nothing before you.
Surely every man stands as a breath.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Surely every man walks like a shadow.
    Surely they busy themselves in vain.
    He heaps up, and doesn’t know who shall gather.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now, Lord, what do I wait for?
    My hope is in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from all my transgressions.
    Don’t make me the reproach of the foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was mute.
    I didn’t open my mouth,
    because you did it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove your scourge away from me.
    I am overcome by the blow of your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you rebuke and correct man for iniquity,
    you consume his wealth like a moth.
Surely every man is but a breath.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Hear my prayer, Yahweh, and give ear to my cry.
    Don’t be silent at my tears.
For I am a stranger with you,
    a foreigner, as all my fathers were.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh spare me, that I may recover strength,
    before I go away and exist no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I waited patiently for Yahweh.
    He turned to me, and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought me up also out of a horrible pit,
    out of the miry clay.
He set my feet on a rock,
    and gave me a firm place to stand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God.
    Many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust,
    and doesn’t respect the proud, nor such as turn away to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many, Yahweh, my God, are the wonderful works which you have done,
    and your thoughts which are toward us.
They can’t be declared back to you.
    If I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be counted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sacrifice and offering you didn’t desire.
    You have opened my ears.
    You have not required burnt offering and sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, “Behold, I have come.
    It is written about me in the book in the scroll.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I delight to do your will, my God.
    Yes, your law is within my heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have proclaimed glad news of righteousness in the great assembly.
    Behold, I will not seal my lips, Yahweh, you know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not hidden your righteousness within my heart.
    I have declared your faithfulness and your salvation.
    I have not concealed your loving kindness and your truth from the great assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t withhold your tender mercies from me, Yahweh.
    Let your loving kindness and your truth continually preserve me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For innumerable evils have surrounded me.
    My iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up.
They are more than the hairs of my head.
    My heart has failed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be pleased, Yahweh, to deliver me.
    Hurry to help me, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be disappointed and confounded together who seek after my soul to destroy it.
    Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor who delight in my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be desolate by reason of their shame that tell me, “Aha! Aha!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
    Let such as love your salvation say continually, “Let Yahweh be exalted!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am poor and needy.
    May the Lord think about me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
    Don’t delay, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is he who considers the poor.
    Yahweh will deliver him in the day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will preserve him, and keep him alive.
    He shall be blessed on the earth,
    and he will not surrender him to the will of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will sustain him on his sickbed,
    and restore him from his bed of illness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “Yahweh, have mercy on me!
    Heal me, for I have sinned against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies speak evil against me:
    “When will he die, and his name perish?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
If he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood.
    His heart gathers iniquity to itself.
    When he goes abroad, he tells it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who hate me whisper together against me.
    They imagine the worst for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“An evil disease”, they say, “has afflicted him.
    Now that he lies he shall rise up no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,
    who ate bread with me,
    has lifted up his heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, Yahweh, have mercy on me, and raise me up,
    that I may repay them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By this I know that you delight in me,
    because my enemy doesn’t triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, you uphold me in my integrity,
    and set me in your presence forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting and to everlasting!
Amen and amen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the deer pants for the water brooks,
    so my soul pants after you, God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
    When shall I come and appear before God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My tears have been my food day and night,
    while they continually ask me, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me,
    how I used to go with the crowd, and led them to God’s house,
    with the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping a holy day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you in despair, my soul?
    Why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God!
    For I shall still praise him for the saving help of his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, my soul is in despair within me.
    Therefore I remember you from the land of the Jordan,
    the heights of Hermon, from the hill Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls.
    All your waves and your billows have swept over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will command his loving kindness in the daytime.
    In the night his song shall be with me:
    a prayer to the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will ask God, my rock, “Why have you forgotten me?
    Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As with a sword in my bones, my adversaries reproach me,
    while they continually ask me, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you in despair, my soul?
    Why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God! For I shall still praise him,
    the saving help of my countenance, and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vindicate me, God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation.
    Oh, deliver me from deceitful and wicked men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are the God of my strength. Why have you rejected me?
    Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, send out your light and your truth.
    Let them lead me.
    Let them bring me to your holy hill,
    to your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
    to God, my exceeding joy.
I will praise you on the harp, God, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you in despair, my soul?
    Why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God!
    For I shall still praise him:
    my Savior, my helper, and my God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You drove out the nations with your hand,
    but you planted them.
You afflicted the peoples,
    but you spread them abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they didn’t get the land in possession by their own sword,
    neither did their own arm save them;
but your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face,
    because you were favorable to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, you are my King.
    Command victories for Jacob!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through you, we will push down our adversaries.
    Through your name, we will tread down those who rise up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will not trust in my bow,
    neither will my sword save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have saved us from our adversaries,
    and have shamed those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God we have made our boast all day long.
    We will give thanks to your name forever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But now you rejected us, and brought us to dishonor,
    and don’t go out with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us turn back from the adversary.
    Those who hate us take plunder for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made us like sheep for food,
    and have scattered us among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sell your people for nothing,
    and have gained nothing from their sale.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us a reproach to our neighbors,
    a scoffing and a derision to those who are around us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us a byword among the nations,
    a shaking of the head among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long my dishonor is before me,
    and shame covers my face,
speaker: Narrator

text:
at the taunt of one who reproaches and verbally abuses,
    because of the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All this has come on us,
    yet we haven’t forgotten you.
    We haven’t been false to your covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our heart has not turned back,
    neither have our steps strayed from your path,
speaker: Narrator

text:
though you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals,
    and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If we have forgotten the name of our God,
    or spread out our hands to a strange god,
speaker: Narrator

text:
won’t God search this out?
    For he knows the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, for your sake we are killed all day long.
    We are regarded as sheep for the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up!
    Why do you sleep, Lord?
Arise!
    Don’t reject us forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you hide your face,
    and forget our affliction and our oppression?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our soul is bowed down to the dust.
    Our body clings to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up to help us.
    Redeem us for your loving kindness’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart overflows with a noble theme.
    I recite my verses for the king.
    My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the most excellent of the sons of men.
    Grace has anointed your lips,
    therefore God has blessed you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strap your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
    in your splendor and your majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your majesty ride on victoriously on behalf of truth, humility, and righteousness.
    Let your right hand display awesome deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your arrows are sharp.
    The nations fall under you, with arrows in the heart of the king’s enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne, God, is forever and ever.
    A scepter of equity is the scepter of your kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have loved righteousness, and hated wickedness.
    Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
