All your garments smell like myrrh, aloes, and cassia.
    Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made you glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kings’ daughters are among your honorable women.
    At your right hand the queen stands in gold of Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, daughter, consider, and turn your ear.
    Forget your own people, and also your father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the king will desire your beauty,
    honor him, for he is your lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The daughter of Tyre comes with a gift.
    The rich among the people entreat your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The princess inside is all glorious.
    Her clothing is interwoven with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She shall be led to the king in embroidered work.
    The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With gladness and rejoicing they shall be led.
    They shall enter into the king’s palace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your sons will take the place of your fathers.
    You shall make them princes in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make your name to be remembered in all generations.
    Therefore the peoples shall give you thanks forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is our refuge and strength,
    a very present help in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore we won’t be afraid, though the earth changes,
    though the mountains are shaken into the heart of the seas;
speaker: Narrator

text:
though its waters roar and are troubled,
    though the mountains tremble with their swelling. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is a river, the streams of which make the city of God glad,
    the holy place of the tents of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is within her. She shall not be moved.
    God will help her at dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations raged. The kingdoms were moved.
    He lifted his voice and the earth melted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh of Armies is with us.
    The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, see Yahweh’s works,
    what desolations he has made in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes wars cease to the end of the earth.
    He breaks the bow, and shatters the spear.
    He burns the chariots in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Be still, and know that I am God.
    I will be exalted among the nations.
    I will be exalted in the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh of Armies is with us.
    The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh clap your hands, all you nations.
    Shout to God with the voice of triumph!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh Most High is awesome.
    He is a great King over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He subdues nations under us,
    and peoples under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He chooses our inheritance for us,
    the glory of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has gone up with a shout,
    Yahweh with the sound of a trumpet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to God! Sing praises!
    Sing praises to our King! Sing praises!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God is the King of all the earth.
    Sing praises with understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God reigns over the nations.
    God sits on his holy throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The princes of the peoples are gathered together,
the people of the God of Abraham.
    For the shields of the earth belong to God.
    He is greatly exalted!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised,
    in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
    is Mount Zion, on the north sides,
    the city of the great King.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has shown himself in her citadels as a refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, the kings assembled themselves,
    they passed by together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They saw it, then they were amazed.
    They were dismayed.
    They hurried away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trembling took hold of them there,
    pain, as of a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the east wind, you break the ships of Tarshish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As we have heard, so we have seen,
    in the city of Yahweh of Armies, in the city of our God.
God will establish it forever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have thought about your loving kindness, God,
    in the middle of your temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As is your name, God,
    so is your praise to the ends of the earth.
    Your right hand is full of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Mount Zion be glad!
    Let the daughters of Judah rejoice because of your judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Walk about Zion, and go around her.
    Number its towers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Notice her bulwarks.
    Consider her palaces,
    that you may tell it to the next generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this God is our God forever and ever.
    He will be our guide even to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, all you peoples.
    Listen, all you inhabitants of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text:
both low and high,
    rich and poor together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth will speak words of wisdom.
    My heart will utter understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will incline my ear to a proverb.
    I will solve my riddle on the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should I fear in the days of evil,
    when iniquity at my heels surrounds me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who trust in their wealth,
    and boast in the multitude of their riches—
speaker: Narrator

text:
none of them can by any means redeem his brother,
    nor give God a ransom for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the redemption of their life is costly,
    no payment is ever enough,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he should live on forever,
    that he should not see corruption.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their inward thought is that their houses will endure forever,
    and their dwelling places to all generations.
    They name their lands after themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But man, despite his riches, doesn’t endure.
    He is like the animals that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the destiny of those who are foolish,
    and of those who approve their sayings. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are appointed as a flock for Sheol.
    Death shall be their shepherd.
The upright shall have dominion over them in the morning.
    Their beauty shall decay in Sheol,
    far from their mansion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol,
    for he will receive me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t be afraid when a man is made rich,
    when the glory of his house is increased;
speaker: Narrator

text:
for when he dies he will carry nothing away.
    His glory won’t descend after him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though while he lived he blessed his soul—
    and men praise you when you do well for yourself—
speaker: Narrator

text:
he shall go to the generation of his fathers.
    They shall never see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man who has riches without understanding,
    is like the animals that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Mighty One, God, Yahweh, speaks,
    and calls the earth from sunrise to sunset.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
    God shines out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our God comes, and does not keep silent.
    A fire devours before him.
    It is very stormy around him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He calls to the heavens above,
    to the earth, that he may judge his people:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Gather my saints together to me,
    those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens shall declare his righteousness,
    for God himself is judge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Hear, my people, and I will speak.
    Israel, I will testify against you.
I am God, your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I don’t rebuke you for your sacrifices.
    Your burnt offerings are continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have no need for a bull from your stall,
    nor male goats from your pens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For every animal of the forest is mine,
    and the livestock on a thousand hills.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know all the birds of the mountains.
    The wild animals of the field are mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
    for the world is mine, and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will I eat the meat of bulls,
    or drink the blood of goats?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving.
    Pay your vows to the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Call on me in the day of trouble.
    I will deliver you, and you will honor me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But to the wicked God says,
    “What right do you have to declare my statutes,
    that you have taken my covenant on your lips,
speaker: Narrator

text:
since you hate instruction,
    and throw my words behind you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you saw a thief, you consented with him,
    and have participated with adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You give your mouth to evil.
    Your tongue frames deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sit and speak against your brother.
    You slander your own mother’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have done these things, and I kept silent.
    You thought that I was just like you.
    I will rebuke you, and accuse you in front of your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now consider this, you who forget God,
    lest I tear you into pieces, and there be no one to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever offers the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me,
    and prepares his way so that I will show God’s salvation to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness.
    According to the multitude of your tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity.
    Cleanse me from my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know my transgressions.
    My sin is constantly before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Against you, and you only, I have sinned,
    and done that which is evil in your sight,
so you may be proved right when you speak,
    and justified when you judge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I was born in iniquity.
    My mother conceived me in sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, you desire truth in the inward parts.
    You teach me wisdom in the inmost place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean.
    Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me hear joy and gladness,
    that the bones which you have broken may rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide your face from my sins,
    and blot out all of my iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Create in me a clean heart, O God.
    Renew a right spirit within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t throw me from your presence,
    and don’t take your Holy Spirit from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation.
    Uphold me with a willing spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will teach transgressors your ways.
    Sinners will be converted to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God, the God of my salvation.
    My tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, open my lips.
    My mouth will declare your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you don’t delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it.
    You have no pleasure in burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit.
    O God, you will not despise a broken and contrite heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do well in your good pleasure to Zion.
    Build the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,
    in burnt offerings and in whole burnt offerings.
Then they will offer bulls on your altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you boast of mischief, mighty man?
    God’s loving kindness endures continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your tongue plots destruction,
    like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love evil more than good,
    lying rather than speaking the truth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love all devouring words,
    you deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God will likewise destroy you forever.
    He will take you up, and pluck you out of your tent,
    and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous also will see it, and fear,
    and laugh at him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, this is the man who didn’t make God his strength,
    but trusted in the abundance of his riches,
    and strengthened himself in his wickedness.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in God’s house.
    I trust in God’s loving kindness forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks forever, because you have done it.
    I will hope in your name, for it is good,
    in the presence of your saints.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”
    They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity.
    There is no one who does good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God looks down from heaven on the children of men,
    to see if there are any who understood,
    who seek after God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every one of them has gone back.
    They have become filthy together.
    There is no one who does good, no, not one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
    who eat up my people as they eat bread,
    and don’t call on God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they were in great fear, where no fear was,
    for God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you.
You have put them to shame,
    because God has rejected them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!
    When God brings back his people from captivity,
    then Jacob shall rejoice,
    and Israel shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me, God, by your name.
    Vindicate me in your might.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer, God.
    Listen to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For strangers have risen up against me.
    Violent men have sought after my soul.
    They haven’t set God before them. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, God is my helper.
    The Lord is the one who sustains my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will repay the evil to my enemies.
    Destroy them in your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With a free will offering, I will sacrifice to you.
    I will give thanks to your name, Yahweh, for it is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has delivered me out of all trouble.
    My eye has seen triumph over my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my prayer, God.
    Don’t hide yourself from my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Attend to me, and answer me.
    I am restless in my complaint,
and moan
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of the voice of the enemy,
    because of the oppression of the wicked.
For they bring suffering on me.
    In anger they hold a grudge against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is severely pained within me.
    The terrors of death have fallen on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fearfulness and trembling have come on me.
    Horror has overwhelmed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “Oh that I had wings like a dove!
    Then I would fly away, and be at rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, then I would wander far off.
    I would lodge in the wilderness.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I would hurry to a shelter from the stormy wind and storm.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Confuse them, Lord, and confound their language,
    for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day and night they prowl around on its walls.
    Malice and abuse are also within her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Destructive forces are within her.
    Threats and lies don’t depart from her streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it was not an enemy who insulted me,
    then I could have endured it.
Neither was it he who hated me who raised himself up against me,
    then I would have hidden myself from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But it was you, a man like me,
    my companion, and my familiar friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We took sweet fellowship together.
    We walked in God’s house with company.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let death come suddenly on them.
    Let them go down alive into Sheol.
    For wickedness is among them, in their dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I will call on God.
    Yahweh will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evening, morning, and at noon, I will cry out in distress.
    He will hear my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me,
    although there are many who oppose me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, who is enthroned forever,
    will hear and answer them. Selah. 
They never change
    and don’t fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He raises his hands against his friends.
    He has violated his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mouth was smooth as butter,
    but his heart was war.
His words were softer than oil,
    yet they were drawn swords.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cast your burden on Yahweh and he will sustain you.
    He will never allow the righteous to be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction.
    Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days,
    but I will trust in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be merciful to me, God, for man wants to swallow me up.
    All day long, he attacks and oppresses me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies want to swallow me up all day long,
    for they are many who fight proudly against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I am afraid,
    I will put my trust in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God, I praise his word.
    In God, I put my trust.
I will not be afraid.
    What can flesh do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long they twist my words.
    All their thoughts are against me for evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They conspire and lurk,
    watching my steps.
    They are eager to take my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall they escape by iniquity?
    In anger cast down the peoples, God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You count my wanderings.
    You put my tears into your container.
    Aren’t they in your book?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then my enemies shall turn back in the day that I call.
    I know this: that God is for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God, I will praise his word.
    In Yahweh, I will praise his word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have put my trust in God.
    I will not be afraid.
    What can man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your vows are on me, God.
    I will give thank offerings to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have delivered my soul from death,
    and prevented my feet from falling,
    that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me,
    for my soul takes refuge in you.
Yes, in the shadow of your wings, I will take refuge,
    until disaster has passed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry out to God Most High,
to God who accomplishes my requests for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will send from heaven, and save me,
    he rebukes the one who is pursuing me. Selah.
God will send out his loving kindness and his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is among lions.
    I lie among those who are set on fire,
    even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows,
    and their tongue a sharp sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, God, above the heavens!
    Let your glory be above all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have prepared a net for my steps.
    My soul is bowed down.
They dig a pit before me.
    They fall into the middle of it themselves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is steadfast, God.
    My heart is steadfast.
    I will sing, yes, I will sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up, my glory! Wake up, lute and harp!
    I will wake up the dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you, Lord, among the peoples.
    I will sing praises to you among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your great loving kindness reaches to the heavens,
    and your truth to the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, God, above the heavens.
    Let your glory be over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do you indeed speak righteousness, silent ones?
    Do you judge blamelessly, you sons of men?
speaker: Narrator

text:
No, in your heart you plot injustice.
    You measure out the violence of your hands in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked go astray from the womb.
    They are wayward as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their poison is like the poison of a snake,
    like a deaf cobra that stops its ear,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which doesn’t listen to the voice of charmers,
    no matter how skillful the charmer may be.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Break their teeth, God, in their mouth.
    Break out the great teeth of the young lions, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them vanish like water that flows away.
    When they draw the bow, let their arrows be made blunt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be like a snail which melts and passes away,
    like the stillborn child, who has not seen the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns,
    he will sweep away the green and the burning alike.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance.
    He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that men shall say, “Most certainly there is a reward for the righteous.
    Most certainly there is a God who judges the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from my enemies, my God.
    Set me on high from those who rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity.
    Save me from the bloodthirsty men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul.
    The mighty gather themselves together against me,
    not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me.
    Rise up, behold, and help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, Yahweh God of Armies, the God of Israel,
    rouse yourself to punish the nations.
    Show no mercy to the wicked traitors. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They return at evening, howling like dogs,
    and prowl around the city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, they spew with their mouth.
    Swords are in their lips,
    “For”, they say, “who hears us?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, Yahweh, laugh at them.
    You scoff at all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, my Strength, I watch for you,
    for God is my high tower.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God will go before me with his loving kindness.
    God will let me look at my enemies in triumph.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t kill them, or my people may forget.
    Scatter them by your power, and bring them down, Lord our shield.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Consume them in wrath.
    Consume them, and they will be no more.
Let them know that God rules in Jacob,
    to the ends of the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At evening let them return.
    Let them howl like a dog, and go around the city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall wander up and down for food,
    and wait all night if they aren’t satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will sing of your strength.
    Yes, I will sing aloud of your loving kindness in the morning.
For you have been my high tower,
    a refuge in the day of my distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To you, my strength, I will sing praises.
    For God is my high tower, the God of my mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, you have rejected us.
    You have broken us down.
You have been angry.
    Restore us, again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made the land tremble.
    You have torn it.
Mend its fractures,
    for it quakes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have shown your people hard things.
    You have made us drink the wine that makes us stagger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given a banner to those who fear you,
    that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that your beloved may be delivered,
    save with your right hand, and answer us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has spoken from his sanctuary:
    “I will triumph.
    I will divide Shechem,
    and measure out the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine.
    Ephraim also is the defense of my head.
    Judah is my scepter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moab is my wash basin.
    I will throw my sandal on Edom.
    I shout in triumph over Philistia.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will bring me into the strong city?
    Who has led me to Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Haven’t you, God, rejected us?
    You don’t go out with our armies, God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give us help against the adversary,
    for the help of man is vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through God we will do valiantly,
    for it is he who will tread down our adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my cry, God.
    Listen to my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the end of the earth, I will call to you when my heart is overwhelmed.
    Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have been a refuge for me,
    a strong tower from the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will dwell in your tent forever.
    I will take refuge in the shelter of your wings. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, God, have heard my vows.
    You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will prolong the king’s life.
    His years will be for generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall be enthroned in God’s presence forever.
    Appoint your loving kindness and truth, that they may preserve him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will sing praise to your name forever,
    that I may fulfill my vows daily.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul rests in God alone.
    My salvation is from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He alone is my rock, my salvation, and my fortress.
    I will never be greatly shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long will you assault a man?
    Would all of you throw him down,
    like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They fully intend to throw him down from his lofty place.
    They delight in lies.
    They bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul, wait in silence for God alone,
    for my expectation is from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress.
    I will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My salvation and my honor is with God.
    The rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in him at all times, you people.
    Pour out your heart before him.
    God is a refuge for us. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely men of low degree are just a breath,
    and men of high degree are a lie.
In the balances they will go up.
    They are together lighter than a breath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t trust in oppression.
    Don’t become vain in robbery.
If riches increase,
    don’t set your heart on them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Also to you, Lord, belongs loving kindness,
    for you reward every man according to his work.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, you are my God.
    I will earnestly seek you.
My soul thirsts for you.
    My flesh longs for you,
    in a dry and weary land, where there is no water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I have seen you in the sanctuary,
    watching your power and your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because your loving kindness is better than life,
    my lips shall praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will bless you while I live.
    I will lift up my hands in your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul shall be satisfied as with the richest food.
    My mouth shall praise you with joyful lips,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when I remember you on my bed,
    and think about you in the night watches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have been my help.
    I will rejoice in the shadow of your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul stays close to you.
    Your right hand holds me up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But those who seek my soul to destroy it
    shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be given over to the power of the sword.
    They shall be jackal food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the king shall rejoice in God.
    Everyone who swears by him will praise him,
    for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be silenced.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my voice, God, in my complaint.
    Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked,
    from the noisy crowd of the ones doing evil;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who sharpen their tongue like a sword,
    and aim their arrows, deadly words,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to shoot innocent men from ambushes.
    They shoot at him suddenly and fearlessly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They encourage themselves in evil plans.
    They talk about laying snares secretly.
    They say, “Who will see them?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They plot injustice, saying, “We have made a perfect plan!”
    Surely man’s mind and heart are cunning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God will shoot at them.
    They will be suddenly struck down with an arrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their own tongues shall ruin them.
    All who see them will shake their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All mankind shall be afraid.
    They shall declare the work of God,
    and shall wisely ponder what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous shall be glad in Yahweh,
    and shall take refuge in him.
    All the upright in heart shall praise him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise waits for you, God, in Zion.
    Vows shall be performed to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who hear prayer,
    all men will come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sins overwhelmed me,
    but you atoned for our transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one whom you choose and cause to come near,
    that he may live in your courts.
    We will be filled with the goodness of your house,
    your holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By awesome deeds of righteousness, you answer us,
    God of our salvation.
You who are the hope of all the ends of the earth,
    of those who are far away on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By your power, you form the mountains,
    having armed yourself with strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You still the roaring of the seas,
    the roaring of their waves,
    and the turmoil of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They also who dwell in faraway places are afraid at your wonders.
    You call the morning’s dawn and the evening with songs of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You visit the earth, and water it.
    You greatly enrich it.
The river of God is full of water.
    You provide them grain, for so you have ordained it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You drench its furrows.
    You level its ridges.
    You soften it with showers.
    You bless it with a crop.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You crown the year with your bounty.
    Your carts overflow with abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wilderness grasslands overflow.
    The hills are clothed with gladness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The pastures are covered with flocks.
    The valleys also are clothed with grain.
They shout for joy!
    They also sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the glory of his name!
    Offer glory and praise!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell God, “How awesome are your deeds!
    Through the greatness of your power, your enemies submit themselves to you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Come, and see God’s deeds—
    awesome work on behalf of the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned the sea into dry land.
    They went through the river on foot.
    There, we rejoiced in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rules by his might forever.
    His eyes watch the nations.
    Don’t let the rebellious rise up against him. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise our God, you peoples!
    Make the sound of his praise heard,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who preserves our life among the living,
    and doesn’t allow our feet to be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, God, have tested us.
    You have refined us, as silver is refined.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You brought us into prison.
    You laid a burden on our backs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You allowed men to ride over our heads.
    We went through fire and through water,
    but you brought us to the place of abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will come into your temple with burnt offerings.
I will pay my vows to you,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which my lips promised,
    and my mouth spoke, when I was in distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will offer to you burnt offerings of fat animals,
    with the offering of rams,
    I will offer bulls with goats. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come and hear, all you who fear God.
    I will declare what he has done for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried to him with my mouth.
    He was extolled with my tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I cherished sin in my heart,
    the Lord wouldn’t have listened.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But most certainly, God has listened.
    He has heard the voice of my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer,
    nor his loving kindness from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May God be merciful to us, bless us,
    and cause his face to shine on us. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That your way may be known on earth,
    and your salvation among all nations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
let the peoples praise you, God.
    Let all the peoples praise you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let the peoples praise you, God.
    Let all the peoples praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth has yielded its increase.
    God, even our own God, will bless us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God will bless us.
    All the ends of the earth shall fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let God arise!
    Let his enemies be scattered!
    Let them who hate him also flee before him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As smoke is driven away,
    so drive them away.
As wax melts before the fire,
    so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let the righteous be glad.
    Let them rejoice before God.
    Yes, let them rejoice with gladness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to God! Sing praises to his name!
    Extol him who rides on the clouds:
to Yah, his name!
    Rejoice before him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows,
    is God in his holy habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God sets the lonely in families.
He brings out the prisoners with singing,
    but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, when you went out before your people,
    when you marched through the wilderness... Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth trembled.
    The sky also poured down rain at the presence of the God of Sinai—
    at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, God, sent a plentiful rain.
    You confirmed your inheritance when it was weary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your congregation lived therein.
    You, God, prepared your goodness for the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord announced the word.
    The ones who proclaim it are a great company.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Kings of armies flee! They flee!”
    She who waits at home divides the plunder,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When the Almighty scattered kings in her,
    it snowed on Zalmon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains of Bashan are majestic mountains.
    The mountains of Bashan are rugged.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you look in envy, you rugged mountains,
    at the mountain where God chooses to reign?
    Yes, Yahweh will dwell there forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands.
    The Lord is among them, from Sinai, into the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have ascended on high.
    You have led away captives.
You have received gifts among people,
    yes, among the rebellious also, that Yah God might dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears our burdens,
    even the God who is our salvation. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is to us a God of deliverance.
    To Yahweh, the Lord, belongs escape from death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God will strike through the head of his enemies,
    the hairy scalp of such a one as still continues in his guiltiness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord said, “I will bring you again from Bashan,
    I will bring you again from the depths of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that you may crush them, dipping your foot in blood,
    that the tongues of your dogs may have their portion from your enemies.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have seen your processions, God,
    even the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The singers went before, the minstrels followed after,
    among the ladies playing with tambourines,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Bless God in the congregations,
    even the Lord in the assembly of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is little Benjamin, their ruler,
    the princes of Judah, their council,
    the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your God has commanded your strength.
    Strengthen, God, that which you have done for us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of your temple at Jerusalem,
    kings shall bring presents to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rebuke the wild animal of the reeds,
    the multitude of the bulls with the calves of the peoples.
Trample under foot the bars of silver.
    Scatter the nations who delight in war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Princes shall come out of Egypt.
    Ethiopia shall hurry to stretch out her hands to God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth!
    Sing praises to the Lord— Selah—
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who rides on the heaven of heavens, which are of old;
    behold, he utters his voice, a mighty voice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe strength to God!
    His excellency is over Israel,
    his strength is in the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are awesome, God, in your sanctuaries.
    The God of Israel gives strength and power to his people.
    Praise be to God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me, God,
    for the waters have come up to my neck!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold.
    I have come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am weary with my crying.
    My throat is dry.
    My eyes fail looking for my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head.
    Those who want to cut me off, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty.
    I have to restore what I didn’t take away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, you know my foolishness.
    My sins aren’t hidden from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let those who wait for you be shamed through me, Lord Yahweh of Armies.
    Don’t let those who seek you be brought to dishonor through me, God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because for your sake, I have borne reproach.
    Shame has covered my face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have become a stranger to my brothers,
    an alien to my mother’s children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the zeal of your house consumes me.
    The reproaches of those who reproach you have fallen on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I wept and I fasted,
    that was to my reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
    I became a byword to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who sit in the gate talk about me.
    I am the song of the drunkards.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, my prayer is to you, Yahweh, in an acceptable time.
    God, in the abundance of your loving kindness, answer me in the truth of your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me out of the mire, and don’t let me sink.
    Let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let the flood waters overwhelm me,
    neither let the deep swallow me up.
    Don’t let the pit shut its mouth on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Answer me, Yahweh, for your loving kindness is good.
    According to the multitude of your tender mercies, turn to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t hide your face from your servant,
    for I am in distress.
    Answer me speedily!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Draw near to my soul and redeem it.
    Ransom me because of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor.
    My adversaries are all before you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They also gave me poison for my food.
    In my thirst, they gave me vinegar to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their table before them become a snare.
    May it become a retribution and a trap.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their eyes be darkened, so that they can’t see.
    Let their backs be continually bent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pour out your indignation on them.
    Let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their habitation be desolate.
    Let no one dwell in their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they persecute him whom you have wounded.
    They tell of the sorrow of those whom you have hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Charge them with crime upon crime.
    Don’t let them come into your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be blotted out of the book of life,
    and not be written with the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am in pain and distress.
    Let your salvation, God, protect me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the name of God with a song,
    and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will please Yahweh better than an ox,
    or a bull that has horns and hoofs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The humble have seen it, and are glad.
    You who seek after God, let your heart live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh hears the needy,
    and doesn’t despise his captive people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let heaven and earth praise him;
    the seas, and everything that moves therein!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah.
    They shall settle there, and own it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children also of his servants shall inherit it.
    Those who love his name shall dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hurry, God, to deliver me.
    Come quickly to help me, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be disappointed and confounded who seek my soul.
    Let those who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be turned because of their shame
    who say, “Aha! Aha!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
    Let those who love your salvation continually say,
    “Let God be exalted!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am poor and needy.
    Come to me quickly, God.
You are my help and my deliverer.
    Yahweh, don’t delay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In you, Yahweh, I take refuge.
    Never let me be disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me.
    Turn your ear to me, and save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be to me a rock of refuge to which I may always go.
    Give the command to save me,
    for you are my rock and my fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me, my God, from the hand of the wicked,
    from the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are my hope, Lord Yahweh,
    my confidence from my youth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have relied on you from the womb.
    You are he who took me out of my mother’s womb.
    I will always praise you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a marvel to many,
    but you are my strong refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth shall be filled with your praise,
    with your honor all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t reject me in my old age.
    Don’t forsake me when my strength fails.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my enemies talk about me.
    Those who watch for my soul conspire together,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “God has forsaken him.
    Pursue and take him, for no one will rescue him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, don’t be far from me.
    My God, hurry to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my accusers be disappointed and consumed.
    Let them be covered with disgrace and scorn who want to harm me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will always hope,
    and will add to all of your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth will tell about your righteousness,
    and of your salvation all day,
    though I don’t know its full measure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Yahweh.
    I will make mention of your righteousness, even of yours alone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, you have taught me from my youth.
    Until now, I have declared your wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, even when I am old and gray-haired, God, don’t forsake me,
    until I have declared your strength to the next generation,
    your might to everyone who is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, your righteousness also reaches to the heavens.
    You have done great things.
    God, who is like you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, who have shown us many and bitter troubles,
    you will let me live.
    You will bring us up again from the depths of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Increase my honor
    and comfort me again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God.
    I sing praises to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My lips shall shout for joy!
    My soul, which you have redeemed, sings praises to you!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
God, give the king your justice;
    your righteousness to the royal son.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will judge your people with righteousness,
    and your poor with justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains shall bring prosperity to the people.
    The hills bring the fruit of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will judge the poor of the people.
    He will save the children of the needy,
    and will break the oppressor in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall fear you while the sun endures;
    and as long as the moon, throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will come down like rain on the mown grass,
    as showers that water the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In his days, the righteous shall flourish,
    and abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,
    from the River to the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him.
    His enemies shall lick the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring tribute.
    The kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, all kings shall fall down before him.
    All nations shall serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will deliver the needy when he cries;
    the poor, who has no helper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will have pity on the poor and needy.
    He will save the souls of the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence.
    Their blood will be precious in his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will live; and Sheba’s gold will be given to him.
    Men will pray for him continually.
    They will bless him all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Abundance of grain shall be throughout the land.
    Its fruit sways like Lebanon.
    Let it flourish, thriving like the grass of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His name endures forever.
    His name continues as long as the sun.
Men shall be blessed by him.
    All nations will call him blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise be to Yahweh God, the God of Israel,
    who alone does marvelous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be his glorious name forever!
    Let the whole earth be filled with his glory!
Amen and amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This ends the prayers by David, the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely God is good to Israel,
    to those who are pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, my feet were almost gone.
    My steps had nearly slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I was envious of the arrogant,
    when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there are no struggles in their death,
    but their strength is firm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are free from burdens of men,
    neither are they plagued like other men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore pride is like a chain around their neck.
    Violence covers them like a garment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their eyes bulge with fat.
    Their minds pass the limits of conceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They scoff and speak with malice.
    In arrogance, they threaten oppression.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have set their mouth in the heavens.
    Their tongue walks through the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore their people return to them,
    and they drink up waters of abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, “How does God know?
    Is there knowledge in the Most High?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, these are the wicked.
    Being always at ease, they increase in riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely I have cleansed my heart in vain,
    and washed my hands in innocence,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all day long I have been plagued,
    and punished every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I had said, “I will speak thus”,
    behold, I would have betrayed the generation of your children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I tried to understand this,
    it was too painful for me—
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I entered God’s sanctuary,
    and considered their latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely you set them in slippery places.
    You throw them down to destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How they are suddenly destroyed!
    They are completely swept away with terrors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a dream when one wakes up,
    so, Lord, when you awake, you will despise their fantasies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my soul was grieved.
    I was embittered in my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was so senseless and ignorant.
    I was a brute beast before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nevertheless, I am continually with you.
    You have held my right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will guide me with your counsel,
    and afterward receive me to glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whom do I have in heaven?
    There is no one on earth whom I desire besides you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My flesh and my heart fails,
    but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, those who are far from you shall perish.
    You have destroyed all those who are unfaithful to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But it is good for me to come close to God.
    I have made the Lord Yahweh my refuge,
    that I may tell of all your works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, why have you rejected us forever?
    Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember your congregation, which you purchased of old,
    which you have redeemed to be the tribe of your inheritance:
    Mount Zion, in which you have lived.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your feet to the perpetual ruins,
    all the evil that the enemy has done in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your adversaries have roared in the middle of your assembly.
    They have set up their standards as signs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They behaved like men wielding axes,
    cutting through a thicket of trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they break all its carved work down with hatchet and hammers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have burned your sanctuary to the ground.
    They have profaned the dwelling place of your Name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They said in their heart, “We will crush them completely.”
    They have burned up all the places in the land where God was worshiped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We see no miraculous signs.
    There is no longer any prophet,
    neither is there among us anyone who knows how long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, God, shall the adversary reproach?
    Shall the enemy blaspheme your name forever?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand?
    Take it from your chest and consume them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet God is my King of old,
    working salvation throughout the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You divided the sea by your strength.
    You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You broke the heads of Leviathan in pieces.
    You gave him as food to people and desert creatures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You opened up spring and stream.
    You dried up mighty rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The day is yours, the night is also yours.
    You have prepared the light and the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have set all the boundaries of the earth.
    You have made summer and winter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember this, that the enemy has mocked you, Yahweh.
    Foolish people have blasphemed your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t deliver the soul of your dove to wild beasts.
    Don’t forget the life of your poor forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor your covenant,
    for haunts of violence fill the dark places of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t let the oppressed return ashamed.
    Let the poor and needy praise your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, God! Plead your own cause.
    Remember how the foolish man mocks you all day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t forget the voice of your adversaries.
    The tumult of those who rise up against you ascends continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We give thanks to you, God.
    We give thanks, for your Name is near.
    Men tell about your wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I choose the appointed time,
    I will judge blamelessly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth and all its inhabitants quake.
    I firmly hold its pillars. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to the arrogant, “Don’t boast!”
    I said to the wicked, “Don’t lift up the horn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t lift up your horn on high.
    Don’t speak with a stiff neck.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For neither from the east, nor from the west,
    nor yet from the south, comes exaltation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God is the judge.
    He puts down one, and lifts up another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For in Yahweh’s hand there is a cup,
    full of foaming wine mixed with spices.
He pours it out.
    Indeed the wicked of the earth drink and drink it to its very dregs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will declare this forever:
    I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cut off all the horns of the wicked,
    but the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In Judah, God is known.
    His name is great in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His tabernacle is also in Salem.
    His dwelling place in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There he broke the flaming arrows of the bow,
    the shield, and the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glorious are you, and excellent,
    more than mountains of game.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Valiant men lie plundered,
    they have slept their last sleep.
    None of the men of war can lift their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At your rebuke, God of Jacob,
    both chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, even you, are to be feared.
    Who can stand in your sight when you are angry?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You pronounced judgment from heaven.
    The earth feared, and was silent,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when God arose to judgment,
    to save all the afflicted ones of the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the wrath of man praises you.
    The survivors of your wrath are restrained.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make vows to Yahweh your God, and fulfill them!
    Let all of his neighbors bring presents to him who is to be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will cut off the spirit of princes.
    He is feared by the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My cry goes to God!
    Indeed, I cry to God for help,
    and for him to listen to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord.
    My hand was stretched out in the night, and didn’t get tired.
    My soul refused to be comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember God, and I groan.
    I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hold my eyelids open.
    I am so troubled that I can’t speak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have considered the days of old,
    the years of ancient times.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Will the Lord reject us forever?
    Will he be favorable no more?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has his loving kindness vanished forever?
    Does his promise fail for generations?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has God forgotten to be gracious?
    Has he, in anger, withheld his compassion?” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I thought, “I will appeal to this:
    the years of the right hand of the Most High.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will remember Yah’s deeds;
    for I will remember your wonders of old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also meditate on all your work,
    and consider your doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your way, God, is in the sanctuary.
    What god is great like God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the God who does wonders.
    You have made your strength known among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have redeemed your people with your arm,
    the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The waters saw you, God.
    The waters saw you, and they writhed.
    The depths also convulsed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The clouds poured out water.
    The skies resounded with thunder.
    Your arrows also flashed around.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of your thunder was in the whirlwind.
    The lightnings lit up the world.
    The earth trembled and shook.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your way was through the sea,
    your paths through the great waters.
    Your footsteps were not known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You led your people like a flock,
    by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my teaching, my people.
    Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will open my mouth in a parable.
    I will utter dark sayings of old,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which we have heard and known,
    and our fathers have told us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We will not hide them from their children,
    telling to the generation to come the praises of Yahweh,
    his strength, and his wondrous deeds that he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he established a covenant in Jacob,
    and appointed a teaching in Israel,
    which he commanded our fathers,
    that they should make them known to their children;
speaker: Narrator

text:
that the generation to come might know, even the children who should be born;
    who should arise and tell their children,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that they might set their hope in God,
    and not forget God’s deeds,
    but keep his commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and might not be as their fathers—
    a stubborn and rebellious generation,
    a generation that didn’t make their hearts loyal,
    whose spirit was not steadfast with God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows,
    turned back in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They didn’t keep God’s covenant,
    and refused to walk in his law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They forgot his doings,
    his wondrous deeds that he had shown them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers,
    in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He split the sea, and caused them to pass through.
    He made the waters stand as a heap.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the daytime he also led them with a cloud,
    and all night with a light of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He split rocks in the wilderness,
    and gave them drink abundantly as out of the depths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought streams also out of the rock,
    and caused waters to run down like rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet they still went on to sin against him,
    to rebel against the Most High in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They tempted God in their heart
    by asking food according to their desire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they spoke against God.
    They said, “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, he struck the rock, so that waters gushed out,
    and streams overflowed.
Can he give bread also?
    Will he provide meat for his people?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore Yahweh heard, and was angry.
    A fire was kindled against Jacob,
    anger also went up against Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because they didn’t believe in God,
    and didn’t trust in his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he commanded the skies above,
    and opened the doors of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rained down manna on them to eat,
    and gave them food from the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man ate the bread of angels.
    He sent them food to the full.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He caused the east wind to blow in the sky.
    By his power he guided the south wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also rained meat on them as the dust,
    winged birds as the sand of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He let them fall in the middle of their camp,
    around their habitations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they ate, and were well filled.
    He gave them their own desire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They didn’t turn from their cravings.
    Their food was yet in their mouths,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when the anger of God went up against them,
    killed some of their strongest,
    and struck down the young men of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all this they still sinned,
    and didn’t believe in his wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he consumed their days in vanity,
    and their years in terror.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he killed them, then they inquired after him.
    They returned and sought God earnestly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They remembered that God was their rock,
    the Most High God, their redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they flattered him with their mouth,
    and lied to him with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their heart was not right with him,
    neither were they faithful in his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he, being merciful, forgave iniquity, and didn’t destroy them.
    Yes, many times he turned his anger away,
    and didn’t stir up all his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembered that they were but flesh,
    a wind that passes away, and doesn’t come again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness,
    and grieved him in the desert!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They turned again and tempted God,
    and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They didn’t remember his hand,
    nor the day when he redeemed them from the adversary;
speaker: Narrator

text:
how he set his signs in Egypt,
    his wonders in the field of Zoan,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he turned their rivers into blood,
    and their streams, so that they could not drink.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them;
    and frogs, which destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also gave their increase to the caterpillar,
    and their labor to the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He destroyed their vines with hail,
    their sycamore fig trees with frost.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also gave over their livestock to the hail,
    and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He threw on them the fierceness of his anger,
    wrath, indignation, and trouble,
    and a band of angels of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made a path for his anger.
    He didn’t spare their soul from death,
    but gave their life over to the pestilence,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and struck all the firstborn in Egypt,
    the chief of their strength in the tents of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he led out his own people like sheep,
    and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them safely, so that they weren’t afraid,
    but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought them to the border of his sanctuary,
    to this mountain, which his right hand had taken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also drove out the nations before them,
    allotted them for an inheritance by line,
    and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God,
    and didn’t keep his testimonies,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers.
    They were twisted like a deceitful bow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
    and moved him to jealousy with their engraved images.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When God heard this, he was angry,
    and greatly abhorred Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that he abandoned the tent of Shiloh,
    the tent which he placed among men,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and delivered his strength into captivity,
    his glory into the adversary’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also gave his people over to the sword,
    and was angry with his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire devoured their young men.
    Their virgins had no wedding song.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their priests fell by the sword,
    and their widows couldn’t weep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep,
    like a mighty man who shouts by reason of wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck his adversaries backward.
    He put them to a perpetual reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover he rejected the tent of Joseph,
    and didn’t choose the tribe of Ephraim,
speaker: Narrator

text:
But chose the tribe of Judah,
    Mount Zion which he loved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He built his sanctuary like the heights,
    like the earth which he has established forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also chose David his servant,
    and took him from the sheepfolds;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart,
    and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, the nations have come into your inheritance.
    They have defiled your holy temple.
    They have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky,
    the flesh of your saints to the animals of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have shed their blood like water around Jerusalem.
    There was no one to bury them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have become a reproach to our neighbors,
    a scoffing and derision to those who are around us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, Yahweh?
    Will you be angry forever?
    Will your jealousy burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations that don’t know you,
    on the kingdoms that don’t call on your name,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for they have devoured Jacob,
    and destroyed his homeland.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t hold the iniquities of our forefathers against us.
    Let your tender mercies speedily meet us,
    for we are in desperate need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help us, God of our salvation, for the glory of your name.
    Deliver us, and forgive our sins, for your name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
    Let it be known among the nations, before our eyes,
    that vengeance for your servants’ blood is being poured out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sighing of the prisoner come before you.
    According to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are sentenced to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pay back to our neighbors seven times into their bosom
    their reproach with which they have reproached you, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So we, your people and sheep of your pasture,
    will give you thanks forever.
    We will praise you forever, to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear us, Shepherd of Israel,
    you who lead Joseph like a flock,
    you who sit above the cherubim, shine out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your might!
    Come to save us!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn us again, God.
    Cause your face to shine,
    and we will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh God of Armies,
    how long will you be angry against the prayer of your people?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have fed them with the bread of tears,
    and given them tears to drink in large measure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us a source of contention to our neighbors.
    Our enemies laugh among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn us again, God of Armies.
    Cause your face to shine,
    and we will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You brought a vine out of Egypt.
    You drove out the nations, and planted it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You cleared the ground for it.
    It took deep root, and filled the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains were covered with its shadow.
    Its boughs were like God’s cedars.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It sent out its branches to the sea,
    its shoots to the River.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why have you broken down its walls,
    so that all those who pass by the way pluck it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The boar out of the wood ravages it.
    The wild animals of the field feed on it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn again, we beg you, God of Armies.
    Look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vine,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the stock which your right hand planted,
    the branch that you made strong for yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It’s burned with fire.
    It’s cut down.
    They perish at your rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,
    on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So we will not turn away from you.
    Revive us, and we will call on your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn us again, Yahweh God of Armies.
    Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing aloud to God, our strength!
    Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Raise a song, and bring here the tambourine,
    the pleasant lyre with the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow the trumpet at the New Moon,
    at the full moon, on our feast day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is a statute for Israel,
    an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He appointed it in Joseph for a covenant,
    when he went out over the land of Egypt,
    I heard a language that I didn’t know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I removed his shoulder from the burden.
    His hands were freed from the basket.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You called in trouble, and I delivered you.
    I answered you in the secret place of thunder.
    I tested you at the waters of Meribah.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Hear, my people, and I will testify to you,
    Israel, if you would listen to me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
There shall be no strange god in you,
    neither shall you worship any foreign god.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am Yahweh, your God,
    who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
    Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my people didn’t listen to my voice.
    Israel desired none of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I let them go after the stubbornness of their hearts,
    that they might walk in their own counsels.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that my people would listen to me,
    that Israel would walk in my ways!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I would soon subdue their enemies,
    and turn my hand against their adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The haters of Yahweh would cringe before him,
    and their punishment would last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he would have also fed them with the finest of the wheat.
    I will satisfy you with honey out of the rock.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
God presides in the great assembly.
    He judges among the gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“How long will you judge unjustly,
    and show partiality to the wicked?” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Defend the weak, the poor, and the fatherless.
    Maintain the rights of the poor and oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue the weak and needy.
    Deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They don’t know, neither do they understand.
    They walk back and forth in darkness.
    All the foundations of the earth are shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “You are gods,
    all of you are sons of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nevertheless you shall die like men,
    and fall like one of the rulers.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, God, judge the earth,
    for you inherit all of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, don’t keep silent.
    Don’t keep silent,
    and don’t be still, God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, your enemies are stirred up.
    Those who hate you have lifted up their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They conspire with cunning against your people.
    They plot against your cherished ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Come,” they say, “let’s destroy them as a nation,
    that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they have conspired together with one mind.
    They form an alliance against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites;
    Moab, and the Hagrites;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek;
    Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Assyria also is joined with them.
    They have helped the children of Lot. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do to them as you did to Midian,
    as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who perished at Endor,
    who became as dung for the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,
    yes, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
speaker: Narrator

text: who said, “Let’s take possession of God’s pasture lands.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, make them like tumbleweed,
    like chaff before the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the fire that burns the forest,
    as the flame that sets the mountains on fire,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so pursue them with your tempest,
    and terrify them with your storm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fill their faces with confusion,
    that they may seek your name, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be disappointed and dismayed forever.
    Yes, let them be confounded and perish;
speaker: Narrator

text:
that they may know that you alone, whose name is Yahweh,
    are the Most High over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How lovely are your dwellings,
    Yahweh of Armies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of Yahweh.
    My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, the sparrow has found a home,
    and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may have her young,
    near your altars, Yahweh of Armies, my King, and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who dwell in your house.
    They are always praising you. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those whose strength is in you,
    who have set their hearts on a pilgrimage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Passing through the valley of Weeping, they make it a place of springs.
    Yes, the autumn rain covers it with blessings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They go from strength to strength.
    Every one of them appears before God in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, God of Armies, hear my prayer.
    Listen, God of Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, God our shield,
    look at the face of your anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a day in your courts is better than a thousand.
    I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God,
    than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh God is a sun and a shield.
    Yahweh will give grace and glory.
    He withholds no good thing from those who walk blamelessly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh of Armies,
    blessed is the man who trusts in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, you have been favorable to your land.
    You have restored the fortunes of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have forgiven the iniquity of your people.
    You have covered all their sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have taken away all your wrath.
    You have turned from the fierceness of your anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn us, God of our salvation,
    and cause your indignation toward us to cease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will you be angry with us forever?
    Will you draw out your anger to all generations?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Won’t you revive us again,
    that your people may rejoice in you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show us your loving kindness, Yahweh.
    Grant us your salvation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Surely his salvation is near those who fear him,
    that glory may dwell in our land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mercy and truth meet together.
    Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truth springs out of the earth.
    Righteousness has looked down from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good.
    Our land will yield its increase.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteousness goes before him,
    and prepares the way for his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, Yahweh, and answer me,
    for I am poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Preserve my soul, for I am godly.
    You, my God, save your servant who trusts in you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
