Be merciful to me, Lord,
    for I call to you all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bring joy to the soul of your servant,
    for to you, Lord, do I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive,
    abundant in loving kindness to all those who call on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, Yahweh, my prayer.
    Listen to the voice of my petitions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the day of my trouble I will call on you,
    for you will answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no one like you among the gods, Lord,
    nor any deeds like your deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All nations you have made will come and worship before you, Lord.
    They shall glorify your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are great, and do wondrous things.
    You are God alone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me your way, Yahweh.
    I will walk in your truth.
    Make my heart undivided to fear your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise you, Lord my God, with my whole heart.
    I will glorify your name forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your loving kindness is great toward me.
    You have delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, the proud have risen up against me.
    A company of violent men have sought after my soul,
    and they don’t hold regard for you before them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, Lord, are a merciful and gracious God,
    slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me, and have mercy on me!
    Give your strength to your servant.
    Save the son of your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show me a sign of your goodness,
    that those who hate me may see it, and be shamed,
    because you, Yahweh, have helped me, and comforted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: His foundation is in the holy mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will record Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me.
    Behold, Philistia, Tyre, and also Ethiopia:
    “This one was born there.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, of Zion it will be said, “This one and that one was born in her;”
    the Most High himself will establish her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will count, when he writes up the peoples,
    “This one was born there.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who sing as well as those who dance say,
    “All my springs are in you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, the God of my salvation,
    I have cried day and night before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my prayer enter into your presence.
    Turn your ear to my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my soul is full of troubles.
    My life draws near to Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am counted among those who go down into the pit.
    I am like a man who has no help,
speaker: Narrator

text:
set apart among the dead,
    like the slain who lie in the grave,
    whom you remember no more.
    They are cut off from your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have laid me in the lowest pit,
    in the darkest depths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wrath lies heavily on me.
    You have afflicted me with all your waves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have taken my friends from me.
    You have made me an abomination to them.
    I am confined, and I can’t escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are dim from grief.
    I have called on you daily, Yahweh.
    I have spread out my hands to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do you show wonders to the dead?
    Do the departed spirits rise up and praise you? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is your loving kindness declared in the grave?
    Or your faithfulness in Destruction?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are your wonders made known in the dark?
    Or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But to you, Yahweh, I have cried.
    In the morning, my prayer comes before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, why do you reject my soul?
    Why do you hide your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up.
    While I suffer your terrors, I am distracted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your fierce wrath has gone over me.
    Your terrors have cut me off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They came around me like water all day long.
    They completely engulfed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have put lover and friend far from me,
    and my friends into darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing of the loving kindness of Yahweh forever.
    With my mouth, I will make known your faithfulness to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I indeed declare, “Love stands firm forever.
    You established the heavens.
    Your faithfulness is in them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I have made a covenant with my chosen one,
    I have sworn to David, my servant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘I will establish your offspring forever,
    and build up your throne to all generations.’” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens will praise your wonders, Yahweh,
    your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For who in the skies can be compared to Yahweh?
    Who among the sons of the heavenly beings is like Yahweh,
speaker: Narrator

text:
a very awesome God in the council of the holy ones,
    to be feared above all those who are around him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, God of Armies, who is a mighty one, like you?
    Yah, your faithfulness is around you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rule the pride of the sea.
    When its waves rise up, you calm them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have broken Rahab in pieces, like one of the slain.
    You have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are yours.
    The earth also is yours,
    the world and its fullness.
    You have founded them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have created the north and the south.
    Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have a mighty arm.
    Your hand is strong, and your right hand is exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.
    Loving kindness and truth go before your face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are the people who learn to acclaim you.
    They walk in the light of your presence, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your name they rejoice all day.
    In your righteousness, they are exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you are the glory of their strength.
    In your favor, our horn will be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our shield belongs to Yahweh,
    our king to the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you spoke in vision to your saints,
    and said, “I have given strength to the warrior.
    I have exalted a young man from the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have found David, my servant.
    I have anointed him with my holy oil,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with whom my hand shall be established.
    My arm will also strengthen him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No enemy will tax him.
    No wicked man will oppress him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will beat down his adversaries before him,
    and strike those who hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my faithfulness and my loving kindness will be with him.
    In my name, his horn will be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will set his hand also on the sea,
    and his right hand on the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will call to me, ‘You are my Father,
    my God, and the rock of my salvation!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also appoint him my firstborn,
    the highest of the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will keep my loving kindness for him forever more.
    My covenant will stand firm with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also make his offspring endure forever,
    and his throne as the days of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If his children forsake my law,
    and don’t walk in my ordinances;
speaker: Narrator

text:
if they break my statutes,
    and don’t keep my commandments;
speaker: Narrator

text:
then I will punish their sin with the rod,
    and their iniquity with stripes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will not completely take my loving kindness from him,
    nor allow my faithfulness to fail.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not break my covenant,
    nor alter what my lips have uttered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Once I have sworn by my holiness,
    I will not lie to David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His offspring will endure forever,
    his throne like the sun before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be established forever like the moon,
    the faithful witness in the sky.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have rejected and spurned.
    You have been angry with your anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have renounced the covenant of your servant.
    You have defiled his crown in the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have broken down all his hedges.
    You have brought his strongholds to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who pass by the way rob him.
He has become a reproach to his neighbors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries.
    You have made all of his enemies rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, you turn back the edge of his sword,
    and haven’t supported him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have ended his splendor,
    and thrown his throne down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have shortened the days of his youth.
    You have covered him with shame. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, Yahweh?
    Will you hide yourself forever?
    Will your wrath burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember how short my time is,
    for what vanity you have created all the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
What man is he who shall live and not see death,
    who shall deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, where are your former loving kindnesses,
    which you swore to David in your faithfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, Lord, the reproach of your servants,
    how I bear in my heart the taunts of all the mighty peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text:
With which your enemies have mocked, Yahweh,
    with which they have mocked the footsteps of your anointed one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh forever more.
Amen, and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before the mountains were born,
    before you had formed the earth and the world,
    even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You turn man to destruction, saying,
    “Return, you children of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a thousand years in your sight are just like yesterday when it is past,
    like a watch in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sweep them away as they sleep.
    In the morning they sprout like new grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the morning it sprouts and springs up.
    By evening, it is withered and dry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For we are consumed in your anger.
    We are troubled in your wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have set our iniquities before you,
    our secret sins in the light of your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all our days have passed away in your wrath.
    We bring our years to an end as a sigh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The days of our years are seventy,
    or even by reason of strength eighty years;
    yet their pride is but labor and sorrow,
    for it passes quickly, and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who knows the power of your anger,
    your wrath according to the fear that is due to you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
So teach us to count our days,
    that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Relent, Yahweh!
    How long?
    Have compassion on your servants!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Satisfy us in the morning with your loving kindness,
    that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
    for as many years as we have seen evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your work appear to your servants,
    your glory to their children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the favor of the Lord our God be on us.
    Establish the work of our hands for us.
    Yes, establish the work of our hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High
    will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will say of Yahweh, “He is my refuge and my fortress;
    my God, in whom I trust.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler,
    and from the deadly pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will cover you with his feathers.
    Under his wings you will take refuge.
    His faithfulness is your shield and rampart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall not be afraid of the terror by night,
    nor of the arrow that flies by day,
speaker: Narrator

text:
nor of the pestilence that walks in darkness,
    nor of the destruction that wastes at noonday.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You will only look with your eyes,
    and see the recompense of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because you have made Yahweh your refuge,
    and the Most High your dwelling place,
speaker: Narrator

text:
no evil shall happen to you,
    neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will put his angels in charge of you,
    to guard you in all your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will bear you up in their hands,
    so that you won’t dash your foot against a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will tread on the lion and cobra.
    You will trample the young lion and the serpent underfoot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Because he has set his love on me, therefore I will deliver him.
    I will set him on high, because he has known my name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will call on me, and I will answer him.
    I will be with him in trouble.
    I will deliver him, and honor him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will satisfy him with long life,
    and show him my salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh,
    to sing praises to your name, Most High,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to proclaim your loving kindness in the morning,
    and your faithfulness every night,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with the ten-stringed lute, with the harp,
    and with the melody of the lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, Yahweh, have made me glad through your work.
    I will triumph in the works of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How great are your works, Yahweh!
    Your thoughts are very deep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A senseless man doesn’t know,
    neither does a fool understand this:
speaker: Narrator

text:
though the wicked spring up as the grass,
    and all the evildoers flourish,
    they will be destroyed forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, Yahweh, are on high forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For behold, your enemies, Yahweh,
    for behold, your enemies shall perish.
    All the evildoers will be scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox.
    I am anointed with fresh oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eye has also seen my enemies.
    My ears have heard of the wicked enemies who rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree.
    He will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are planted in Yahweh’s house.
    They will flourish in our God’s courts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will still produce fruit in old age.
    They will be full of sap and green,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to show that Yahweh is upright.
He is my rock,
    and there is no unrighteousness in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh reigns!
    He is clothed with majesty!
    Yahweh is armed with strength.
The world also is established.
    It can’t be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your throne is established from long ago.
    You are from everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The floods have lifted up, Yahweh,
    the floods have lifted up their voice.
    The floods lift up their waves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Above the voices of many waters,
    the mighty breakers of the sea,
    Yahweh on high is mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your statutes stand firm.
    Holiness adorns your house,
    Yahweh, forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, you God to whom vengeance belongs,
    you God to whom vengeance belongs, shine out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up, you judge of the earth.
    Pay back the proud what they deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, how long will the wicked,
    how long will the wicked triumph?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They pour out arrogant words.
    All the evildoers boast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They break your people in pieces, Yahweh,
    and afflict your heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They kill the widow and the alien,
    and murder the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, “Yah will not see,
    neither will Jacob’s God consider.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider, you senseless among the people;
    you fools, when will you be wise?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who implanted the ear, won’t he hear?
    He who formed the eye, won’t he see?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who disciplines the nations, won’t he punish?
    He who teaches man knows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh knows the thoughts of man,
    that they are futile.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man whom you discipline, Yah,
    and teach out of your law,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that you may give him rest from the days of adversity,
    until the pit is dug for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh won’t reject his people,
    neither will he forsake his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For judgment will return to righteousness.
    All the upright in heart shall follow it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will rise up for me against the wicked?
    Who will stand up for me against the evildoers?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unless Yahweh had been my help,
    my soul would have soon lived in silence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I said, “My foot is slipping!”
    Your loving kindness, Yahweh, held me up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the multitude of my thoughts within me,
    your comforts delight my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with you,
    which brings about mischief by statute?
speaker: Narrator

text:
They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,
    and condemn the innocent blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Yahweh has been my high tower,
    my God, the rock of my refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has brought on them their own iniquity,
    and will cut them off in their own wickedness.
    Yahweh, our God, will cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh come, let’s sing to Yahweh.
    Let’s shout aloud to the rock of our salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let’s come before his presence with thanksgiving.
    Let’s extol him with songs!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh is a great God,
    a great King above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In his hand are the deep places of the earth.
    The heights of the mountains are also his.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea is his, and he made it.
    His hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh come, let’s worship and bow down.
    Let’s kneel before Yahweh, our Maker,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for he is our God.
We are the people of his pasture,
    and the sheep in his care.
Today, oh that you would hear his voice!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t harden your heart, as at Meribah,
    as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when your fathers tempted me,
    tested me, and saw my work.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Forty long years I was grieved with that generation,
    and said, “They are a people who err in their heart.
    They have not known my ways.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I swore in my wrath,
    “They won’t enter into my rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Yahweh a new song!
    Sing to Yahweh, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Yahweh!
    Bless his name!
    Proclaim his salvation from day to day!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    his marvelous works among all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh is great, and greatly to be praised!
    He is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
    but Yahweh made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor and majesty are before him.
    Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of nations,
    ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name.
    Bring an offering, and come into his courts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship Yahweh in holy array.
    Tremble before him, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say among the nations, “Yahweh reigns.”
    The world is also established.
    It can’t be moved.
    He will judge the peoples with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice.
    Let the sea roar, and its fullness!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the field and all that is in it exult!
    Then all the trees of the woods shall sing for joy
speaker: Narrator

text:
before Yahweh; for he comes,
    for he comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness,
    the peoples with his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh reigns!
    Let the earth rejoice!
    Let the multitude of islands be glad!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Clouds and darkness are around him.
    Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fire goes before him,
    and burns up his adversaries on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His lightning lights up the world.
    The earth sees, and trembles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh,
    at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens declare his righteousness.
    All the peoples have seen his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all them be shamed who serve engraved images,
    who boast in their idols.
    Worship him, all you gods!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Zion heard and was glad.
    The daughters of Judah rejoiced
    because of your judgments, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you, Yahweh, are most high above all the earth.
    You are exalted far above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who love Yahweh, hate evil!
    He preserves the souls of his saints.
    He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light is sown for the righteous,
    and gladness for the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be glad in Yahweh, you righteous people!
    Give thanks to his holy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Yahweh a new song,
    for he has done marvelous things!
    His right hand and his holy arm have worked salvation for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has made known his salvation.
    He has openly shown his righteousness in the sight of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has remembered his loving kindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel.
    All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make a joyful noise to Yahweh, all the earth!
    Burst out and sing for joy, yes, sing praises!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to Yahweh with the harp,
    with the harp and the voice of melody.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With trumpets and sound of the ram’s horn,
    make a joyful noise before the King, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea roar with its fullness;
    the world, and those who dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the rivers clap their hands.
    Let the mountains sing for joy together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them sing before Yahweh,
    for he comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness,
    and the peoples with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh reigns! Let the peoples tremble.
    He sits enthroned among the cherubim.
    Let the earth be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is great in Zion.
    He is high above all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise your great and awesome name.
    He is Holy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The King’s strength also loves justice.
    You establish equity.
    You execute justice and righteousness in Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Exalt Yahweh our God.
    Worship at his footstool.
    He is Holy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests,
    Samuel was among those who call on his name.
    They called on Yahweh, and he answered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud.
    They kept his testimonies,
    the statute that he gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You answered them, Yahweh our God.
    You are a God who forgave them,
    although you took vengeance for their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Exalt Yahweh, our God.
    Worship at his holy hill,
    for Yahweh, our God, is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout for joy to Yahweh, all you lands!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Serve Yahweh with gladness.
    Come before his presence with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Know that Yahweh, he is God.
    It is he who has made us, and we are his.
    We are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,
    and into his courts with praise.
    Give thanks to him, and bless his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh is good.
    His loving kindness endures forever,
    his faithfulness to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing of loving kindness and justice.
    To you, Yahweh, I will sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be careful to live a blameless life.
    When will you come to me?
    I will walk within my house with a blameless heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will set no vile thing before my eyes.
    I hate the deeds of faithless men.
    They will not cling to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A perverse heart will be far from me.
    I will have nothing to do with evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will silence whoever secretly slanders his neighbor.
    I won’t tolerate one who is arrogant and conceited.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes will be on the faithful of the land,
    that they may dwell with me.
He who walks in a perfect way,
    he will serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who practices deceit won’t dwell within my house.
    He who speaks falsehood won’t be established before my eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Morning by morning, I will destroy all the wicked of the land,
    to cut off all the workers of iniquity from Yahweh’s city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer, Yahweh!
    Let my cry come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t hide your face from me in the day of my distress.
    Turn your ear to me.
    Answer me quickly in the day when I call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my days consume away like smoke.
    My bones are burned as a torch.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is blighted like grass, and withered,
    for I forget to eat my bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By reason of the voice of my groaning,
    my bones stick to my skin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am like a pelican of the wilderness.
    I have become as an owl of the waste places.
speaker: Narrator

text: I watch, and have become like a sparrow that is alone on the housetop.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies reproach me all day.
    Those who are mad at me use my name as a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
    and mixed my drink with tears,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because of your indignation and your wrath;
    for you have taken me up and thrown me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My days are like a long shadow.
    I have withered like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, Yahweh, will remain forever;
    your renown endures to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will arise and have mercy on Zion,
    for it is time to have pity on her.
    Yes, the set time has come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your servants take pleasure in her stones,
    and have pity on her dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the nations will fear Yahweh’s name,
    all the kings of the earth your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh has built up Zion.
    He has appeared in his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has responded to the prayer of the destitute,
    and has not despised their prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This will be written for the generation to come.
    A people which will be created will praise Yah,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary.
    From heaven, Yahweh saw the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to hear the groans of the prisoner,
    to free those who are condemned to death,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that men may declare Yahweh’s name in Zion,
    and his praise in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when the peoples are gathered together,
    the kingdoms, to serve Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He weakened my strength along the course.
    He shortened my days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “My God, don’t take me away in the middle of my days.
    Your years are throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of old, you laid the foundation of the earth.
    The heavens are the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will perish, but you will endure.
    Yes, all of them will wear out like a garment.
    You will change them like a cloak, and they will be changed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are the same.
    Your years will have no end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of your servants will continue.
    Their offspring will be established before you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, my soul!
    All that is within me, praise his holy name!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, my soul,
    and don’t forget all his benefits,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who forgives all your sins,
    who heals all your diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who redeems your life from destruction,
    who crowns you with loving kindness and tender mercies,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who satisfies your desire with good things,
    so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh executes righteous acts,
    and justice for all who are oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made known his ways to Moses,
    his deeds to the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is merciful and gracious,
    slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not always accuse;
    neither will he stay angry forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
    nor repaid us for our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
    so great is his loving kindness toward those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As far as the east is from the west,
    so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a father has compassion on his children,
    so Yahweh has compassion on those who fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he knows how we are made.
    He remembers that we are dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for man, his days are like grass.
    As a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the wind passes over it, and it is gone.
    Its place remembers it no more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Yahweh’s loving kindness is from everlasting to everlasting with those who fear him,
    his righteousness to children’s children,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to those who keep his covenant,
    to those who remember to obey his precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has established his throne in the heavens.
    His kingdom rules over all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, you angels of his,
    who are mighty in strength, who fulfill his word,
    obeying the voice of his word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, all you armies of his,
    you servants of his, who do his pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, all you works of his,
    in all places of his dominion.
    Praise Yahweh, my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless Yahweh, my soul.
    Yahweh, my God, you are very great.
    You are clothed with honor and majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He covers himself with light as with a garment.
    He stretches out the heavens like a curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He lays the beams of his rooms in the waters.
    He makes the clouds his chariot.
    He walks on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes his messengers winds,
    and his servants flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He laid the foundations of the earth,
    that it should not be moved forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You covered it with the deep as with a cloak.
    The waters stood above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At your rebuke they fled.
    At the voice of your thunder they hurried away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains rose,
    the valleys sank down,
    to the place which you had assigned to them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have set a boundary that they may not pass over,
    that they don’t turn again to cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends springs into the valleys.
    They run among the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They give drink to every animal of the field.
    The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The birds of the sky nest by them.
    They sing among the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He waters the mountains from his rooms.
    The earth is filled with the fruit of your works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He causes the grass to grow for the livestock,
    and plants for man to cultivate,
    that he may produce food out of the earth:
speaker: Narrator

text:
wine that makes the heart of man glad,
    oil to make his face to shine,
    and bread that strengthens man’s heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s trees are well watered,
    the cedars of Lebanon, which he has planted,
speaker: Narrator

text:
where the birds make their nests.
    The stork makes its home in the cypress trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The high mountains are for the wild goats.
    The rocks are a refuge for the rock badgers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He appointed the moon for seasons.
    The sun knows when to set.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make darkness, and it is night,
    in which all the animals of the forest prowl.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions roar after their prey,
    and seek their food from God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun rises, and they steal away,
    and lie down in their dens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man goes out to his work,
    to his labor until the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, how many are your works!
    In wisdom, you have made them all.
    The earth is full of your riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is the sea, great and wide,
    in which are innumerable living things,
    both small and large animals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the ships go,
    and leviathan, whom you formed to play there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These all wait for you,
    that you may give them their food in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give to them; they gather.
    You open your hand; they are satisfied with good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hide your face; they are troubled.
    You take away their breath; they die and return to the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You send out your Spirit and they are created.
    You renew the face of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Yahweh’s glory endure forever.
    Let Yahweh rejoice in his works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He looks at the earth, and it trembles.
    He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to Yahweh as long as I live.
    I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my meditation be sweet to him.
    I will rejoice in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth.
    Let the wicked be no more.
    Bless Yahweh, my soul.
    Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name!
    Make his doings known among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him, sing praises to him!
    Tell of all his marvelous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glory in his holy name.
    Let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek Yahweh and his strength.
    Seek his face forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember his marvelous works that he has done:
    his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you offspring of Abraham, his servant,
    you children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is Yahweh, our God.
    His judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has remembered his covenant forever,
    the word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the covenant which he made with Abraham,
    his oath to Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and confirmed it to Jacob for a statute;
    to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
    the lot of your inheritance,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
when they were but a few men in number,
    yes, very few, and foreigners in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They went about from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He allowed no one to do them wrong.
    Yes, he reproved kings for their sakes,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Don’t touch my anointed ones!
    Do my prophets no harm!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He called for a famine on the land.
    He destroyed the food supplies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent a man before them.
    Joseph was sold for a slave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They bruised his feet with shackles.
    His neck was locked in irons,
speaker: Narrator

text:
until the time that his word happened,
    and Yahweh’s word proved him true.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king sent and freed him,
    even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made him lord of his house,
    and ruler of all of his possessions,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to discipline his princes at his pleasure,
    and to teach his elders wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel also came into Egypt.
    Jacob lived in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He increased his people greatly,
    and made them stronger than their adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their heart to hate his people,
    to conspire against his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent Moses, his servant,
    and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They performed miracles among them,
    and wonders in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent darkness, and made it dark.
    They didn’t rebel against his words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their waters into blood,
    and killed their fish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
    even in the rooms of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and swarms of flies came,
    and lice in all their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them hail for rain,
    with lightning in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck their vines and also their fig trees,
    and shattered the trees of their country.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and the locusts came
    with the grasshoppers, without number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They ate up every plant in their land,
    and ate up the fruit of their ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck also all the firstborn in their land,
    the first fruits of all their manhood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought them out with silver and gold.
    There was not one feeble person among his tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
    for the fear of them had fallen on them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spread a cloud for a covering,
    fire to give light in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked, and he brought quails,
    and satisfied them with the bread of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He opened the rock, and waters gushed out.
    They ran as a river in the dry places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he remembered his holy word,
    and Abraham, his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought his people out with joy,
    his chosen with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them the lands of the nations.
    They took the labor of the peoples in possession,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that they might keep his statutes,
    and observe his laws.
    Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh!
    Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can utter the mighty acts of Yahweh,
    or fully declare all his praise?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who keep justice.
    Blessed is one who does what is right at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember me, Yahweh, with the favor that you show to your people.
    Visit me with your salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that I may see the prosperity of your chosen,
    that I may rejoice in the gladness of your nation,
    that I may glory with your inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have sinned with our fathers.
    We have committed iniquity.
    We have done wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our fathers didn’t understand your wonders in Egypt.
    They didn’t remember the multitude of your loving kindnesses,
    but were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake,
    that he might make his mighty power known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up;
    so he led them through the depths, as through a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He saved them from the hand of him who hated them,
    and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The waters covered their adversaries.
    There was not one of them left.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they believed his words.
    They sang his praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They soon forgot his works.
    They didn’t wait for his counsel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but gave in to craving in the desert,
    and tested God in the wasteland.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them their request,
    but sent leanness into their soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They envied Moses also in the camp,
    and Aaron, Yahweh’s saint.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
    and covered the company of Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fire was kindled in their company.
    The flame burned up the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made a calf in Horeb,
    and worshiped a molten image.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they exchanged their glory
    for an image of a bull that eats grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They forgot God, their Savior,
    who had done great things in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wondrous works in the land of Ham,
    and awesome things by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he said that he would destroy them,
    had Moses, his chosen, not stood before him in the breach,
    to turn away his wrath, so that he wouldn’t destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they despised the pleasant land.
    They didn’t believe his word,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but murmured in their tents,
    and didn’t listen to Yahweh’s voice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he swore to them
    that he would overthrow them in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he would overthrow their offspring among the nations,
    and scatter them in the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They joined themselves also to Baal Peor,
    and ate the sacrifices of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they provoked him to anger with their deeds.
    The plague broke in on them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Phinehas stood up and executed judgment,
    so the plague was stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That was credited to him for righteousness,
    for all generations to come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They angered him also at the waters of Meribah,
    so that Moses was troubled for their sakes;
speaker: Narrator

text:
because they were rebellious against his spirit,
    he spoke rashly with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They didn’t destroy the peoples,
    as Yahweh commanded them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but mixed themselves with the nations,
    and learned their works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They served their idols,
    which became a snare to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shed innocent blood,
    even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
    whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan.
    The land was polluted with blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they were defiled with their works,
    and prostituted themselves in their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore Yahweh burned with anger against his people.
    He abhorred his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them into the hand of the nations.
    Those who hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their enemies also oppressed them.
    They were brought into subjection under their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rescued them many times,
    but they were rebellious in their counsel,
    and were brought low in their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nevertheless he regarded their distress,
    when he heard their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembered for them his covenant,
    and repented according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made them also to be pitied
    by all those who carried them captive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save us, Yahweh, our God,
    gather us from among the nations,
    to give thanks to your holy name,
    to triumph in your praise!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting even to everlasting!
Let all the people say, “Amen.”
    Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the redeemed by Yahweh say so,
    whom he has redeemed from the hand of the adversary,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way.
    They found no city to live in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hungry and thirsty,
    their soul fainted in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to Yahweh in their trouble,
    and he delivered them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them also by a straight way,
    that they might go to a city to live in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness,
    for his wonderful deeds to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he satisfies the longing soul.
    He fills the hungry soul with good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,
    being bound in affliction and iron,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because they rebelled against the words of God,
    and condemned the counsel of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he brought down their heart with labor.
    They fell down, and there was no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to Yahweh in their trouble,
    and he saved them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
    and broke away their chains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness,
    for his wonderful deeds to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has broken the gates of bronze,
    and cut through bars of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fools are afflicted because of their disobedience,
    and because of their iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their soul abhors all kinds of food.
    They draw near to the gates of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cry to Yahweh in their trouble,
    and he saves them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends his word, and heals them,
    and delivers them from their graves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness,
    for his wonderful deeds to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,
    and declare his deeds with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who go down to the sea in ships,
    who do business in great waters,
speaker: Narrator

text:
these see Yahweh’s deeds,
    and his wonders in the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he commands, and raises the stormy wind,
    which lifts up its waves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They mount up to the sky; they go down again to the depths.
    Their soul melts away because of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They reel back and forth, and stagger like a drunken man,
    and are at their wits’ end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cry to Yahweh in their trouble,
    and he brings them out of their distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes the storm a calm,
    so that its waves are still.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they are glad because it is calm,
    so he brings them to their desired haven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness,
    for his wonderful deeds for the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people,
    and praise him in the seat of the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns rivers into a desert,
    water springs into a thirsty ground,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and a fruitful land into a salt waste,
    for the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turns a desert into a pool of water,
    and a dry land into water springs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There he makes the hungry live,
    that they may prepare a city to live in,
speaker: Narrator

text:
sow fields, plant vineyards,
    and reap the fruits of increase.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly.
    He doesn’t allow their livestock to decrease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Again, they are diminished and bowed down
    through oppression, trouble, and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He pours contempt on princes,
    and causes them to wander in a trackless waste.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet he lifts the needy out of their affliction,
    and increases their families like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The upright will see it, and be glad.
    All the wicked will shut their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever is wise will pay attention to these things.
    They will consider the loving kindnesses of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is steadfast, God.
    I will sing and I will make music with my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wake up, harp and lyre!
    I will wake up the dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations.
    I will sing praises to you among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your loving kindness is great above the heavens.
    Your faithfulness reaches to the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, God, above the heavens!
    Let your glory be over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That your beloved may be delivered,
    save with your right hand, and answer us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has spoken from his sanctuary: “In triumph,
    I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gilead is mine. Manasseh is mine.
    Ephraim also is my helmet.
    Judah is my scepter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moab is my wash pot.
    I will toss my sandal on Edom.
    I will shout over Philistia.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
    Who will lead me to Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Haven’t you rejected us, God?
    You don’t go out, God, with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give us help against the enemy,
    for the help of man is vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through God, we will do valiantly,
    for it is he who will tread down our enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: God of my praise, don’t remain silent,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for they have opened the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit against me.
    They have spoken to me with a lying tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred,
    and fought against me without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In return for my love, they are my adversaries;
    but I am in prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have rewarded me evil for good,
    and hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Set a wicked man over him.
    Let an adversary stand at his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he is judged, let him come out guilty.
    Let his prayer be turned into sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his days be few.
    Let another take his office.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his children be fatherless,
    and his wife a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his children be wandering beggars.
    Let them be sought from their ruins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the creditor seize all that he has.
    Let strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let there be no one to extend kindness to him,
    neither let there be anyone to have pity on his fatherless children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his posterity be cut off.
    In the generation following let their name be blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered by Yahweh.
    Don’t let the sin of his mother be blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be before Yahweh continually,
    that he may cut off their memory from the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text:
because he didn’t remember to show kindness,
    but persecuted the poor and needy man,
    the broken in heart, to kill them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, he loved cursing, and it came to him.
    He didn’t delight in blessing, and it was far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment.
    It came into his inward parts like water,
    like oil into his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let it be to him as the clothing with which he covers himself,
    for the belt that is always around him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the reward of my adversaries from Yahweh,
    of those who speak evil against my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But deal with me, Yahweh the Lord, for your name’s sake,
    because your loving kindness is good, deliver me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
for I am poor and needy.
    My heart is wounded within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I fade away like an evening shadow.
    I am shaken off like a locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My knees are weak through fasting.
    My body is thin and lacks fat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have also become a reproach to them.
    When they see me, they shake their head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me, Yahweh, my God.
    Save me according to your loving kindness;
speaker: Narrator

text:
that they may know that this is your hand;
    that you, Yahweh, have done it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They may curse, but you bless.
    When they arise, they will be shamed,
    but your servant shall rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my adversaries be clothed with dishonor.
    Let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give great thanks to Yahweh with my mouth.
    Yes, I will praise him among the multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will stand at the right hand of the needy,
    to save him from those who judge his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh says to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
    until I make your enemies your footstool for your feet.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will send out the rod of your strength out of Zion.
    Rule among your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your people offer themselves willingly in the day of your power, in holy array.
    Out of the womb of the morning, you have the dew of your youth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has sworn, and will not change his mind:
    “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is at your right hand.
    He will crush kings in the day of his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will judge among the nations.
    He will heap up dead bodies.
    He will crush the ruler of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will drink of the brook on the way;
    therefore he will lift up his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart,
    in the council of the upright, and in the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh’s works are great,
    pondered by all those who delight in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His work is honor and majesty.
    His righteousness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has caused his wonderful works to be remembered.
    Yahweh is gracious and merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has given food to those who fear him.
    He always remembers his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has shown his people the power of his works,
    in giving them the heritage of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The works of his hands are truth and justice.
    All his precepts are sure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are established forever and ever.
    They are done in truth and uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has sent redemption to his people.
    He has ordained his covenant forever.
    His name is holy and awesome!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom.
    All those who do his work have a good understanding.
His praise endures forever!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    Blessed is the man who fears Yahweh,
    who delights greatly in his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His offspring will be mighty in the land.
    The generation of the upright will be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth and riches are in his house.
    His righteousness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light dawns in the darkness for the upright,
    gracious, merciful, and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is well with the man who deals graciously and lends.
    He will maintain his cause in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will never be shaken.
    The righteous will be remembered forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not be afraid of evil news.
    His heart is steadfast, trusting in Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His heart is established.
    He will not be afraid in the end when he sees his adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has dispersed, he has given to the poor.
    His righteousness endures forever.
    His horn will be exalted with honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked will see it, and be grieved.
    He shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away.
    The desire of the wicked will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    Praise, you servants of Yahweh,
    praise Yahweh’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh’s name,
    from this time forward and forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the rising of the sun to its going down,
    Yahweh’s name is to be praised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is high above all nations,
    his glory above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is like Yahweh, our God,
    who has his seat on high,
speaker: Narrator

text: who stoops down to see in heaven and in the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He raises up the poor out of the dust,
    and lifts up the needy from the ash heap,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that he may set him with princes,
    even with the princes of his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He settles the barren woman in her home
    as a joyful mother of children.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Israel went out of Egypt,
    the house of Jacob from a people of foreign language,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judah became his sanctuary,
    Israel his dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea saw it, and fled.
    The Jordan was driven back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
    the little hills like lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What was it, you sea, that you fled?
    You Jordan, that you turned back?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You mountains, that you skipped like rams?
    You little hills, like lambs?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble, you earth, at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the God of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who turned the rock into a pool of water,
    the flint into a spring of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Not to us, Yahweh, not to us,
    but to your name give glory,
    for your loving kindness, and for your truth’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God, now?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But our God is in the heavens.
    He does whatever he pleases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their idols are silver and gold,
    the work of men’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but they don’t speak.
    They have eyes, but they don’t see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears, but they don’t hear.
    They have noses, but they don’t smell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have hands, but they don’t feel.
    They have feet, but they don’t walk,
    neither do they speak through their throat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who make them will be like them;
    yes, everyone who trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel, trust in Yahweh!
    He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
House of Aaron, trust in Yahweh!
    He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who fear Yahweh, trust in Yahweh!
    He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh remembers us. He will bless us.
    He will bless the house of Israel.
    He will bless the house of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will bless those who fear Yahweh,
    both small and great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Yahweh increase you more and more,
    you and your children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are you by Yahweh,
    who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are Yahweh’s heavens,
    but he has given the earth to the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The dead don’t praise Yah,
    nor any who go down into silence,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but we will bless Yah,
    from this time forward and forever more.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love Yahweh, because he listens to my voice,
    and my cries for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because he has turned his ear to me,
    therefore I will call on him as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of death surrounded me,
    the pains of Sheol got a hold of me.
    I found trouble and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I called on Yahweh’s name:
    “Yahweh, I beg you, deliver my soul.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is gracious and righteous.
    Yes, our God is merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh preserves the simple.
    I was brought low, and he saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return to your rest, my soul,
    for Yahweh has dealt bountifully with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you have delivered my soul from death,
    my eyes from tears,
    and my feet from falling.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will walk before Yahweh in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I believed, therefore I said,
    “I was greatly afflicted.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said in my haste,
    “All people are liars.”
speaker: Narrator

text: What will I give to Yahweh for all his benefits toward me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will take the cup of salvation, and call on Yahweh’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will pay my vows to Yahweh,
    yes, in the presence of all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Precious in Yahweh’s sight is the death of his saints.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, truly I am your servant.
    I am your servant, the son of your servant girl.
    You have freed me from my chains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
    and will call on Yahweh’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will pay my vows to Yahweh,
    yes, in the presence of all his people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in the courts of Yahweh’s house,
    in the middle of you, Jerusalem.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, all you nations!
    Extol him, all you peoples!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For his loving kindness is great toward us.
    Yahweh’s faithfulness endures forever.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Israel now say
    that his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the house of Aaron now say
    that his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now let those who fear Yahweh say
    that his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of my distress, I called on Yah.
    Yah answered me with freedom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is on my side. I will not be afraid.
    What can man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is on my side among those who help me.
    Therefore I will look in triumph at those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in Yahweh,
    than to put confidence in man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in Yahweh,
    than to put confidence in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the nations surrounded me,
    but in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me.
    In Yahweh’s name I indeed cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surrounded me like bees.
    They are quenched like the burning thorns.
    In Yahweh’s name I cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You pushed me back hard, to make me fall,
    but Yahweh helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yah is my strength and song.
    He has become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous.
    “The right hand of Yahweh does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The right hand of Yahweh is exalted!
    The right hand of Yahweh does valiantly!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not die, but live,
    and declare Yah’s works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yah has punished me severely,
    but he has not given me over to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open to me the gates of righteousness.
    I will enter into them.
    I will give thanks to Yah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the gate of Yahweh;
    the righteous will enter into it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me,
    and have become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The stone which the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is Yahweh’s doing.
    It is marvelous in our eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the day that Yahweh has made.
    We will rejoice and be glad in it!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save us now, we beg you, Yahweh!
    Yahweh, we beg you, send prosperity now.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is he who comes in Yahweh’s name!
    We have blessed you out of Yahweh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is God, and he has given us light.
    Bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my God, and I will give thanks to you.
    You are my God, I will exalt you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those whose ways are blameless,
    who walk according to Yahweh’s law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are those who keep his statutes,
    who seek him with their whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they do nothing wrong.
    They walk in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have commanded your precepts,
    that we should fully obey them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that my ways were steadfast
    to obey your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I wouldn’t be disappointed,
    when I consider all of your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you with uprightness of heart,
    when I learn your righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will observe your statutes.
    Don’t utterly forsake me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can a young man keep his way pure?
    By living according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my whole heart I have sought you.
    Don’t let me wander from your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have hidden your word in my heart,
    that I might not sin against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are you, Yahweh.
    Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my lips,
    I have declared all the ordinances of your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have rejoiced in the way of your testimonies,
    as much as in all riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will meditate on your precepts,
    and consider your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will delight myself in your statutes.
    I will not forget your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do good to your servant.
    I will live and I will obey your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open my eyes,
    that I may see wondrous things out of your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a stranger on the earth.
    Don’t hide your commandments from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is consumed with longing for your ordinances at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rebuked the proud who are cursed,
    who wander from your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take reproach and contempt away from me,
    for I have kept your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though princes sit and slander me,
    your servant will meditate on your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed your statutes are my delight,
    and my counselors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is laid low in the dust.
    Revive me according to your word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I declared my ways, and you answered me.
    Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me understand the teaching of your precepts!
    Then I will meditate on your wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is weary with sorrow;
    strengthen me according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me from the way of deceit.
    Grant me your law graciously!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have chosen the way of truth.
    I have set your ordinances before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cling to your statutes, Yahweh.
    Don’t let me be disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I run in the path of your commandments,
    for you have set my heart free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me, Yahweh, the way of your statutes.
    I will keep them to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me understanding, and I will keep your law.
    Yes, I will obey it with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Direct me in the path of your commandments,
    for I delight in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn my heart toward your statutes,
    not toward selfish gain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn my eyes away from looking at worthless things.
    Revive me in your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fulfill your promise to your servant,
    that you may be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away my disgrace that I dread,
    for your ordinances are good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I long for your precepts!
    Revive me in your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your loving kindness also come to me, Yahweh,
    your salvation, according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will have an answer for him who reproaches me,
    for I trust in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t snatch the word of truth out of my mouth,
    for I put my hope in your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will obey your law continually,
    forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will walk in liberty,
    for I have sought your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also speak of your statutes before kings,
    and will not be disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will delight myself in your commandments,
    because I love them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I reach out my hands for your commandments, which I love.
    I will meditate on your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember your word to your servant,
    because you gave me hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is my comfort in my affliction,
    for your word has revived me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arrogant mock me excessively,
    but I don’t swerve from your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember your ordinances of old, Yahweh,
    and have comforted myself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indignation has taken hold on me,
    because of the wicked who forsake your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your statutes have been my songs
    in the house where I live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have remembered your name, Yahweh, in the night,
    and I obey your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is my way,
    that I keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is my portion.
    I promised to obey your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sought your favor with my whole heart.
    Be merciful to me according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I considered my ways,
    and turned my steps to your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will hurry, and not delay,
    to obey your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ropes of the wicked bind me,
    but I won’t forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you,
    because of your righteous ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a friend of all those who fear you,
    of those who observe your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth is full of your loving kindness, Yahweh.
    Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have treated your servant well,
    according to your word, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me good judgment and knowledge,
    for I believe in your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before I was afflicted, I went astray;
    but now I observe your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good, and do good.
    Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The proud have smeared a lie upon me.
    With my whole heart, I will keep your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their heart is as callous as the fat,
    but I delight in your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
    that I may learn your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of your mouth is better to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hands have made me and formed me.
    Give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who fear you will see me and be glad,
    because I have put my hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, I know that your judgments are righteous,
    that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Please let your loving kindness be for my comfort,
    according to your word to your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your tender mercies come to me, that I may live;
    for your law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the proud be disappointed, for they have overthrown me wrongfully.
    I will meditate on your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those who fear you turn to me.
    They will know your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my heart be blameless toward your decrees,
    that I may not be disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul faints for your salvation.
    I hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes fail for your word.
    I say, “When will you comfort me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke.
    I don’t forget your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How many are the days of your servant?
    When will you execute judgment on those who persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The proud have dug pits for me,
    contrary to your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of your commandments are faithful.
    They persecute me wrongfully.
    Help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They had almost wiped me from the earth,
    but I didn’t forsake your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Preserve my life according to your loving kindness,
    so I will obey the statutes of your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh, your word is settled in heaven forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your faithfulness is to all generations.
    You have established the earth, and it remains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your laws remain to this day,
    for all things serve you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unless your law had been my delight,
    I would have perished in my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will never forget your precepts,
    for with them, you have revived me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am yours.
    Save me, for I have sought your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me.
    I will consider your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen a limit to all perfection,
    but your commands are boundless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How I love your law!
    It is my meditation all day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
    for your commandments are always with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have more understanding than all my teachers,
    for your testimonies are my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I understand more than the aged,
    because I have kept your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have kept my feet from every evil way,
    that I might observe your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not turned away from your ordinances,
    for you have taught me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How sweet are your promises to my taste,
    more than honey to my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through your precepts, I get understanding;
    therefore I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a lamp to my feet,
    and a light for my path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sworn, and have confirmed it,
    that I will obey your righteous ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am afflicted very much.
    Revive me, Yahweh, according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Accept, I beg you, the willing offerings of my mouth.
    Yahweh, teach me your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is continually in my hand,
    yet I won’t forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
    yet I haven’t gone astray from your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have taken your testimonies as a heritage forever,
    for they are the joy of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have set my heart to perform your statutes forever,
    even to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate double-minded men,
    but I love your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place and my shield.
    I hope in your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
