Depart from me, you evildoers,
    that I may keep the commandments of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uphold me according to your word, that I may live.
    Let me not be ashamed of my hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hold me up, and I will be safe,
    and will have respect for your statutes continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You reject all those who stray from your statutes,
    for their deceit is in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You put away all the wicked of the earth like dross.
    Therefore I love your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My flesh trembles for fear of you.
    I am afraid of your judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have done what is just and righteous.
    Don’t leave me to my oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ensure your servant’s well-being.
    Don’t let the proud oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes fail looking for your salvation,
    for your righteous word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deal with your servant according to your loving kindness.
    Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am your servant. Give me understanding,
    that I may know your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is time to act, Yahweh,
    for they break your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I love your commandments more than gold,
    yes, more than pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I consider all of your precepts to be right.
    I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are wonderful,
    therefore my soul keeps them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The entrance of your words gives light.
    It gives understanding to the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I opened my mouth wide and panted,
    for I longed for your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
    as you always do to those who love your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Establish my footsteps in your word.
    Don’t let any iniquity have dominion over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Redeem me from the oppression of man,
    so I will observe your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make your face shine on your servant.
    Teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Streams of tears run down my eyes,
    because they don’t observe your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are righteous, Yahweh.
    Your judgments are upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have commanded your statutes in righteousness.
    They are fully trustworthy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My zeal wears me out,
    because my enemies ignore your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your promises have been thoroughly tested,
    and your servant loves them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am small and despised.
    I don’t forget your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness.
    Your law is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trouble and anguish have taken hold of me.
    Your commandments are my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are righteous forever.
    Give me understanding, that I may live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called with my whole heart.
    Answer me, Yahweh!
    I will keep your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called to you. Save me!
    I will obey your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rise before dawn and cry for help.
    I put my hope in your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes stay open through the night watches,
    that I might meditate on your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my voice according to your loving kindness.
    Revive me, Yahweh, according to your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They draw near who follow after wickedness.
    They are far from your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are near, Yahweh.
    All your commandments are truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of old I have known from your testimonies,
    that you have founded them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider my affliction, and deliver me,
    for I don’t forget your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Plead my cause, and redeem me!
    Revive me according to your promise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
    for they don’t seek your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great are your tender mercies, Yahweh.
    Revive me according to your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are my persecutors and my adversaries.
    I haven’t swerved from your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I look at the faithless with loathing,
    because they don’t observe your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider how I love your precepts.
    Revive me, Yahweh, according to your loving kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of your words are truth.
    Every one of your righteous ordinances endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
    but my heart stands in awe of your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rejoice at your word,
    as one who finds great plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate and abhor falsehood.
    I love your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seven times a day, I praise you,
    because of your righteous ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who love your law have great peace.
    Nothing causes them to stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have hoped for your salvation, Yahweh.
    I have done your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul has observed your testimonies.
    I love them exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have obeyed your precepts and your testimonies,
    for all my ways are before you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my cry come before you, Yahweh.
    Give me understanding according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my supplication come before you.
    Deliver me according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my lips utter praise,
    for you teach me your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my tongue sing of your word,
    for all your commandments are righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your hand be ready to help me,
    for I have chosen your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have longed for your salvation, Yahweh.
    Your law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my soul live, that I may praise you.
    Let your ordinances help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have gone astray like a lost sheep.
    Seek your servant, for I don’t forget your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress, I cried to Yahweh.
    He answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver my soul, Yahweh, from lying lips,
    from a deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What will be given to you, and what will be done more to you,
    you deceitful tongue?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sharp arrows of the mighty,
    with coals of juniper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe is me, that I live in Meshech,
    that I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul has had her dwelling too long
    with him who hates peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am for peace,
    but when I speak, they are for war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lift up my eyes to the hills.
    Where does my help come from?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My help comes from Yahweh,
    who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not allow your foot to be moved.
    He who keeps you will not slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, he who keeps Israel
    will neither slumber nor sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is your keeper.
    Yahweh is your shade on your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will not harm you by day,
    nor the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will keep you from all evil.
    He will keep your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will keep your going out and your coming in,
    from this time forward, and forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was glad when they said to me,
    “Let’s go to Yahweh’s house!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet are standing within your gates, Jerusalem!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together,
speaker: Narrator

text:
where the tribes go up, even Yah’s tribes,
    according to an ordinance for Israel,
    to give thanks to Yahweh’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there are set thrones for judgment,
    the thrones of David’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem.
    Those who love you will prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Peace be within your walls,
    and prosperity within your palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my brothers’ and companions’ sakes,
    I will now say, “Peace be within you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God,
    I will seek your good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lift up my eyes to you,
    you who sit in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
    as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress,
    so our eyes look to Yahweh, our God,
    until he has mercy on us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have mercy on us, Yahweh, have mercy on us,
    for we have endured much contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scoffing of those who are at ease,
    with the contempt of the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,
    let Israel now say,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,
    when men rose up against us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then they would have swallowed us up alive,
    when their wrath was kindled against us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then the waters would have overwhelmed us,
    the stream would have gone over our soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh,
    who has not given us as a prey to their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul has escaped like a bird out of the fowler’s snare.
    The snare is broken, and we have escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our help is in Yahweh’s name,
    who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who trust in Yahweh are as Mount Zion,
    which can’t be moved, but remains forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
    so Yahweh surrounds his people from this time forward and forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the scepter of wickedness won’t remain over the allotment of the righteous,
    so that the righteous won’t use their hands to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do good, Yahweh, to those who are good,
    to those who are upright in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for those who turn away to their crooked ways,
    Yahweh will lead them away with the workers of iniquity.
Peace be on Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Yahweh brought back those who returned to Zion,
    we were like those who dream.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then our mouth was filled with laughter,
    and our tongue with singing.
Then they said among the nations,
    “Yahweh has done great things for them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has done great things for us,
    and we are glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore our fortunes again, Yahweh,
    like the streams in the Negev.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who sow in tears will reap in joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing,
    will certainly come again with joy, carrying his sheaves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unless Yahweh builds the house,
    they who build it labor in vain.
Unless Yahweh watches over the city,
    the watchman guards it in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is vain for you to rise up early,
    to stay up late,
    eating the bread of toil,
    for he gives sleep to his loved ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, children are a heritage of Yahweh.
    The fruit of the womb is his reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As arrows in the hand of a mighty man,
    so are the children of youth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them.
    They won’t be disappointed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh,
    who walks in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will eat the labor of your hands.
    You will be happy, and it will be well with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wife will be as a fruitful vine in the innermost parts of your house,
    your children like olive shoots around your table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, this is how the man who fears Yahweh is blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Yahweh bless you out of Zion,
    and may you see the good of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, may you see your children’s children.
    Peace be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up.
    Let Israel now say:
speaker: Narrator

text:
many times they have afflicted me from my youth up,
    yet they have not prevailed against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The plowers plowed on my back.
    They made their furrows long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is righteous.
    He has cut apart the cords of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be disappointed and turned backward,
    all those who hate Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be as the grass on the housetops,
    which withers before it grows up,
speaker: Narrator

text:
with which the reaper doesn’t fill his hand,
    nor he who binds sheaves, his bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Neither do those who go by say,
    “The blessing of Yahweh be on you.
    We bless you in Yahweh’s name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the depths I have cried to you, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, hear my voice.
    Let your ears be attentive to the voice of my petitions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you, Yah, kept a record of sins,
    Lord, who could stand?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But there is forgiveness with you,
    therefore you are feared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wait for Yahweh.
    My soul waits.
    I hope in his word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul longs for the Lord more than watchmen long for the morning,
    more than watchmen for the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel, hope in Yahweh,
    for there is loving kindness with Yahweh.
    Abundant redemption is with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will redeem Israel from all their sins.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul,
    like a weaned child with his mother,
    like a weaned child is my soul within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel, hope in Yahweh,
    from this time forward and forever more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh, remember David and all his affliction,
speaker: Narrator

text:
how he swore to Yahweh,
    and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Surely I will not come into the structure of my house,
    nor go up into my bed;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not give sleep to my eyes,
    or slumber to my eyelids,
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I find out a place for Yahweh,
    a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah.
    We found it in the field of Jaar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“We will go into his dwelling place.
    We will worship at his footstool.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, Yahweh, into your resting place,
    you, and the ark of your strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your priests be clothed with righteousness.
    Let your saints shout for joy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your servant David’s sake,
    don’t turn away the face of your anointed one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh has sworn to David in truth.
    He will not turn from it:
    “I will set the fruit of your body on your throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your children will keep my covenant,
    my testimony that I will teach them,
    their children also will sit on your throne forever more.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh has chosen Zion.
    He has desired it for his habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“This is my resting place forever.
    I will live here, for I have desired it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will abundantly bless her provision.
    I will satisfy her poor with bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also clothe her priests with salvation.
    Her saints will shout aloud for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make the horn of David to bud there.
    I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
    but on himself, his crown will shine.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
See how good and how pleasant it is
    for brothers to live together in unity!
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is like the precious oil on the head,
    that ran down on the beard,
    even Aaron’s beard,
    that came down on the edge of his robes,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Look! Praise Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh,
    who stand by night in Yahweh’s house!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary.
    Praise Yahweh!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
    even he who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    Praise Yahweh’s name!
    Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you who stand in Yahweh’s house,
    in the courts of our God’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah, for Yahweh is good.
    Sing praises to his name, for that is pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself,
    Israel for his own possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know that Yahweh is great,
    that our Lord is above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whatever Yahweh pleased, that he has done,
    in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth.
    He makes lightnings with the rain.
    He brings the wind out of his treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck the firstborn of Egypt,
    both of man and animal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt,
    on Pharaoh, and on all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck many nations,
    and killed mighty kings—
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    Og king of Bashan,
    and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
speaker: Narrator

text:
and gave their land for a heritage,
    a heritage to Israel, his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your name, Yahweh, endures forever;
    your renown, Yahweh, throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh will judge his people
    and have compassion on his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
    the work of men’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but they can’t speak.
    They have eyes, but they can’t see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears, but they can’t hear,
    neither is there any breath in their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who make them will be like them,
    yes, everyone who trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
House of Israel, praise Yahweh!
    House of Aaron, praise Yahweh!
speaker: Narrator

text:
House of Levi, praise Yahweh!
    You who fear Yahweh, praise Yahweh!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh from Zion,
    who dwells in Jerusalem.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of gods,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who alone does great wonders,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who by understanding made the heavens,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who spread out the earth above the waters,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who made the great lights,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sun to rule by day,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the moon and stars to rule by night,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who struck down the Egyptian firstborn,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and brought out Israel from among them,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who divided the Red Sea apart,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and made Israel to pass through the middle of it,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who led his people through the wilderness,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to him who struck great kings,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and killed mighty kings,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Og king of Bashan,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and gave their land as an inheritance,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
even a heritage to Israel his servant,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who remembered us in our low estate,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and has delivered us from our adversaries,
    for his loving kindness endures forever;
speaker: Narrator

text:
who gives food to every creature,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the God of heaven,
    for his loving kindness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down.
    Yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the willows in that land,
    we hung up our harps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there, those who led us captive asked us for songs.
    Those who tormented us demanded songs of joy:
    “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”
speaker: Narrator

text: How can we sing Yahweh’s song in a foreign land?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
    let my right hand forget its skill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you,
    if I don’t prefer Jerusalem above my chief joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, Yahweh, against the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem,
    who said, “Raze it!
    Raze it even to its foundation!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction,
    he will be happy who repays you,
    as you have done to us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy shall he be,
    who takes and dashes your little ones against the rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you thanks with my whole heart.
    Before the gods, I will sing praises to you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
In the day that I called, you answered me.
    You encouraged me with strength in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, Yahweh,
    for they have heard the words of your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, they will sing of the ways of Yahweh,
    for Yahweh’s glory is great!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For though Yahweh is high, yet he looks after the lowly;
    but he knows the proud from afar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though I walk in the middle of trouble, you will revive me.
    You will stretch out your hand against the wrath of my enemies.
    Your right hand will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh will fulfill that which concerns me.
    Your loving kindness, Yahweh, endures forever.
    Don’t forsake the works of your own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, you have searched me,
    and you know me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know my sitting down and my rising up.
    You perceive my thoughts from afar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You search out my path and my lying down,
    and are acquainted with all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there is not a word on my tongue,
    but behold, Yahweh, you know it altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hem me in behind and before.
    You laid your hand on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This knowledge is beyond me.
    It’s lofty.
    I can’t attain it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where could I go from your Spirit?
    Or where could I flee from your presence?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I ascend up into heaven, you are there.
    If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I take the wings of the dawn,
    and settle in the uttermost parts of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even there your hand will lead me,
    and your right hand will hold me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me.
    The light around me will be night,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
even the darkness doesn’t hide from you,
    but the night shines as the day.
    The darkness is like light to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you formed my inmost being.
    You knit me together in my mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to you,
    for I am fearfully and wonderfully made.
Your works are wonderful.
    My soul knows that very well.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My frame wasn’t hidden from you,
    when I was made in secret,
    woven together in the depths of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your eyes saw my body.
    In your book they were all written,
    the days that were ordained for me,
    when as yet there were none of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How precious to me are your thoughts, God!
    How vast is their sum!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand.
    When I wake up, I am still with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If only you, God, would kill the wicked.
    Get away from me, you bloodthirsty men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they speak against you wickedly.
    Your enemies take your name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, don’t I hate those who hate you?
    Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate them with perfect hatred.
    They have become my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Search me, God, and know my heart.
    Try me, and know my thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See if there is any wicked way in me,
    and lead me in the everlasting way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me, Yahweh, from evil men.
    Preserve me from violent men:
speaker: Narrator

text:
those who devise mischief in their hearts.
    They continually gather themselves together for war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent.
    Viper’s poison is under their lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, keep me from the hands of the wicked.
    Preserve me from the violent men who have determined to trip my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The proud have hidden a snare for me,
    they have spread the cords of a net by the path.
    They have set traps for me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to Yahweh, “You are my God.”
    Listen to the cry of my petitions, Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
    you have covered my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, don’t grant the desires of the wicked.
    Don’t let their evil plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for the head of those who surround me,
    let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let burning coals fall on them.
    Let them be thrown into the fire,
    into miry pits, from where they never rise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An evil speaker won’t be established in the earth.
    Evil will hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know that Yahweh will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
    and justice for the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name.
    The upright will dwell in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, I have called on you.
    Come to me quickly!
    Listen to my voice when I call to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my prayer be set before you like incense;
    the lifting up of my hands like the evening sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Set a watch, Yahweh, before my mouth.
    Keep the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t incline my heart to any evil thing,
    to practice deeds of wickedness with men who work iniquity.
    Don’t let me eat of their delicacies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock.
    They will hear my words, for they are well spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“As when one plows and breaks up the earth,
    our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my eyes are on you, Yahweh, the Lord.
    I take refuge in you.
    Don’t leave my soul destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
    from the traps of the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the wicked fall together into their own nets
    while I pass by.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry with my voice to Yahweh.
    With my voice, I ask Yahweh for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pour out my complaint before him.
    I tell him my troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,
    you knew my route.
On the path in which I walk,
    they have hidden a snare for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look on my right, and see;
    for there is no one who is concerned for me.
    Refuge has fled from me.
    No one cares for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried to you, Yahweh.
    I said, “You are my refuge,
    my portion in the land of the living.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to my cry,
    for I am in desperate need.
Deliver me from my persecutors,
    for they are too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bring my soul out of prison,
    that I may give thanks to your name.
The righteous will surround me,
    for you will be good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer, Yahweh.
    Listen to my petitions.
    In your faithfulness and righteousness, relieve me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t enter into judgment with your servant,
    for in your sight no man living is righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the enemy pursues my soul.
    He has struck my life down to the ground.
    He has made me live in dark places, as those who have been long dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me.
    My heart within me is desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I remember the days of old.
    I meditate on all your doings.
    I contemplate the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I spread out my hands to you.
    My soul thirsts for you, like a parched land. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hurry to answer me, Yahweh.
    My spirit fails.
Don’t hide your face from me,
    so that I don’t become like those who go down into the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cause me to hear your loving kindness in the morning,
    for I trust in you.
Cause me to know the way in which I should walk,
    for I lift up my soul to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me, Yahweh, from my enemies.
    I flee to you to hide me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me to do your will,
    for you are my God.
Your Spirit is good.
    Lead me in the land of uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Revive me, Yahweh, for your name’s sake.
    In your righteousness, bring my soul out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In your loving kindness, cut off my enemies,
    and destroy all those who afflict my soul,
    for I am your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be Yahweh, my rock,
    who trains my hands to war,
    and my fingers to battle—
speaker: Narrator

text:
my loving kindness, my fortress,
    my high tower, my deliverer,
    my shield, and he in whom I take refuge,
    who subdues my people under me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, what is man, that you care for him?
    Or the son of man, that you think of him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man is like a breath.
    His days are like a shadow that passes away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Part your heavens, Yahweh, and come down.
    Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Throw out lightning, and scatter them.
    Send out your arrows, and rout them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stretch out your hand from above,
    rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters,
    out of the hands of foreigners,
speaker: Narrator

text:
whose mouths speak deceit,
    whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing a new song to you, God.
    On a ten-stringed lyre, I will sing praises to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are he who gives salvation to kings,
    who rescues David, his servant, from the deadly sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hands of foreigners,
    whose mouths speak deceit,
    whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then our sons will be like well-nurtured plants,
    our daughters like pillars carved to adorn a palace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our barns are full, filled with all kinds of provision.
    Our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our oxen will pull heavy loads.
    There is no breaking in, and no going away,
    and no outcry in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy are the people who are in such a situation.
    Happy are the people whose God is Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will exalt you, my God, the King.
    I will praise your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every day I will praise you.
    I will extol your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised!
    His greatness is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One generation will commend your works to another,
    and will declare your mighty acts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will meditate on the glorious majesty of your honor,
    on your wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Men will speak of the might of your awesome acts.
    I will declare your greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will utter the memory of your great goodness,
    and will sing of your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is gracious, merciful,
    slow to anger, and of great loving kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is good to all.
    His tender mercies are over all his works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your works will give thanks to you, Yahweh.
    Your saints will extol you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will speak of the glory of your kingdom,
    and talk about your power,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,
    the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom.
    Your dominion endures throughout all generations.
Yahweh is faithful in all his words,
    and loving in all his deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh upholds all who fall,
    and raises up all those who are bowed down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of all wait for you.
    You give them their food in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You open your hand,
    and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is righteous in all his ways,
    and gracious in all his works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh is near to all those who call on him,
    to all who call on him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him.
    He also will hear their cry, and will save them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh preserves all those who love him,
    but he will destroy all the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh.
    Let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    Praise Yahweh, my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
While I live, I will praise Yahweh.
    I will sing praises to my God as long as I exist.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Don’t put your trust in princes,
    in a son of man in whom there is no help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth.
    In that very day, his thoughts perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,
    whose hope is in Yahweh, his God,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind.
    Yahweh raises up those who are bowed down.
    Yahweh loves the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh preserves the foreigners.
    He upholds the fatherless and widow,
    but he turns the way of the wicked upside down.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Yahweh builds up Jerusalem.
    He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He heals the broken in heart,
    and binds up their wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He counts the number of the stars.
    He calls them all by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is our Lord, and mighty in power.
    His understanding is infinite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh upholds the humble.
    He brings the wicked down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving.
    Sing praises on the harp to our God,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who covers the sky with clouds,
    who prepares rain for the earth,
    who makes grass grow on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He provides food for the livestock,
    and for the young ravens when they call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He doesn’t delight in the strength of the horse.
    He takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him,
    in those who hope in his loving kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem!
    Praise your God, Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he has strengthened the bars of your gates.
    He has blessed your children within you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes peace in your borders.
    He fills you with the finest of the wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends out his commandment to the earth.
    His word runs very swiftly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives snow like wool,
    and scatters frost like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hurls down his hail like pebbles.
    Who can stand before his cold?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends out his word, and melts them.
    He causes his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shows his word to Jacob,
    his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has not done this for just any nation.
    They don’t know his ordinances.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    Praise Yahweh from the heavens!
    Praise him in the heights!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, all his angels!
    Praise him, all his army!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, sun and moon!
    Praise him, all you shining stars!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him, you heavens of heavens,
    you waters that are above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise Yahweh’s name,
    for he commanded, and they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has also established them forever and ever.
    He has made a decree which will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh from the earth,
    you great sea creatures, and all depths,
speaker: Narrator

text:
lightning and hail, snow and clouds,
    stormy wind, fulfilling his word,
speaker: Narrator

text:
mountains and all hills,
    fruit trees and all cedars,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wild animals and all livestock,
    small creatures and flying birds,
speaker: Narrator

text:
kings of the earth and all peoples,
    princes and all judges of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
both young men and maidens,
    old men and children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise Yahweh’s name,
    for his name alone is exalted.
    His glory is above the earth and the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has lifted up the horn of his people,
    the praise of all his saints,
    even of the children of Israel, a people near to him.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yahweh!
    Sing to Yahweh a new song,
    his praise in the assembly of the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Israel rejoice in him who made them.
    Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise his name in the dance!
    Let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people.
    He crowns the humble with salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the saints rejoice in honor.
    Let them sing for joy on their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the high praises of God be in their mouths,
    and a two-edged sword in their hand,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to execute vengeance on the nations,
    and punishments on the peoples;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to bind their kings with chains,
    and their nobles with fetters of iron;
speaker: Narrator

text:
to execute on them the written judgment.
    All his saints have this honor.
Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Yah!
    Praise God in his sanctuary!
    Praise him in his heavens for his acts of power!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him for his mighty acts!
    Praise him according to his excellent greatness!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet!
    Praise him with harp and lyre!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with tambourine and dancing!
    Praise him with stringed instruments and flute!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise him with loud cymbals!
    Praise him with resounding cymbals!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let everything that has breath praise Yah!
    Praise Yah!
speaker: Narrator
